Illinois Scholarships


114Th Regiment, Illinois Volunteer Infantry History Scholarship
ELIGIBILITY
1. Available to first-time or continuing college students
2. Minimum 2.50 cumulative GPA
3. History program of study
4. Enrolled in a minimum of 12 credit hours
5. Must be a resident of Cass, Menard or Sangamon counties
6. Preference to a student with an interest in American History more...

2020 5Estimates.Com Scholarship Program
The Scholarship
5Estiamtes.com is an online service to home owners specializing in cost guides to help users compare prices on most home improvement services. From home windows, to roofs, or kitchen remodeling, we cover nearly every type of contractor solution.
For this reason, we’re pleased to announce the 2020 5Estimates.com scholarship program. We know that affording continued education can be costly, which is why we set up our program to help offset the cost of attending. We will distribute $1,000 in annual awards.
We never share your information with any 3rd parties.
We will not need your social security number, birth date, or any personally identifiable information.
There are NO FEES required to apply for this program.
ELIGIBILITY
The 5Estimates.com is offering this scholarship to students who are currently studying at or have been accepted to an accredited university.
No minimum GPA is required.
Domestic, international, and undocumented students may apply.
All students may apply. Studies in all fields are accepted.
SELECTION AND NOTIFICATION
An internal committee will decide on the best written essay and complete the award by June 30th of each year. Winners will be notified by email and phone (if phone is given).
HOW TO APPLY
Write an essay of 400+ words on the topic of “What Consumers Should Look For in a Home in Improvement Company”.
You will be required to publish the post online publicly. This can be a student blog on your university website, your own personal website, or a blog platform like medium.com, blogger.com, or something similar.
Include at least 2 links that cite authoritative sources on consumer protection or home improvement, including 1 link to www.5Estimates.com.
When complete, email us at info@5estimates.com. Send your full name, college/university name and address, and proof of enrollment. MAKE SURE to send us the url/link where your public post is listed.
DEADLINE
The deadline is to Enter May 30, 2020.
Winner will be selected by June 10th, annually
Disbursement of awards by June 30th, annually
This scholarship repeats annually, and awards 1 winner.
AWARDS
$1000 USD
CONTACT INFORMATION
5Estimates.com
600 Ackerman Lane
Chesapeake, VA 23320
email: info@5estimates.com
Privacy Policy
By submitting your application, we are granted full permission to send applicants information regarding their application only, via their submitted email address.
No applicants will be contacted regarding anything other than their scholarship application.
We will not attempt to sell you anything, nor will we sell, lease, or rent your personally identifiable information.
All information (proof of enrollment, name, and email) relating to applicants is destroyed as soon as a winner is announced.
Applicants emails, names, and phone numbers will not be used for any marketing purpose.
Scholarship Resources
The Federal Student Aid site has important information that may help you on your scholarship journey. https://studentaid.ed.gov/sa/types/grants-scholarships/finding-scholarships
If you are unsure if your school is accredited, you can use the US Department of Education’s search tool to see if your school features on their list.
https://ope.ed.gov/dapip/#/home more...

2020-2021 Organic Bunny Academic Scholarship
The Organic Bunny Scholarship was established in 2020 in an effort to support individuals who want to continue their education by attending college or university, but may need financial assistance along the way.
Amanda Jo, Organic Bunny founder, is an entrepreneur who has built her business around the lifestyle, nutrition and beauty industry. With her many years of business experience, Amanda Jo understands exactly how vital having a degree can be to achieving success.
Understanding the monetary challenges presented when attempting to obtain a higher education, Organic Bunny, Amanda Jo and the scholarship team encourage individuals to continue exploring their passion and apply to this scholarship for $1,000.
More details, requirements and the application can be found below.
Application Details
Scholarship Award Amount
$1,000
Scholarship Deadline
May 31, 2021
Scholarship Eligibility Requirements
Applicants must meet one of the following criteria:
Currently enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate program
Current high school senior that has been accepted into a college or university
Scholarship Essay Topic
Write a 500-word essay answering the below question:
“What is your major, and how do you plan to use it to make your impact on the world?” more...

Growing demand and lack of qualified workers in skilled trades and technology means it’s a great time to go back to school and enter these lucrative and fast-growing industries. To help keep up with demand and assist the next generation of professionals, ISN will award a $2,000 scholarship four times a year to eligible students. more...

Nonrenewable. more...

A3 Superior Pest Control Scholarship
Are you a college or university student or are you about to become one? If you or someone you know could use money towards college we are offering a $1000 ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIP on a yearly basis to all eligible students. A3 Superior Pest Control is offering a $1000 ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIP. All eligible students are welcome to apply. One scholarship will be awarded.
To be eligible we require the following
Minimum GPA of 3
Must be a legal resident of the United States
Be an Undergraduate, Graduate, or Incoming student
Must be planning on earning a Bachelor of Science degree.
General information on the scholarship
Submission deadline is December 1 of each year.
Date of award is January 31 of each year.
Submissions are allowed throughout the year.
To learn more and start your application, click on the Visit button below. more...

Academic Finalist Award
Scholarship for incoming freshmen and tranfer students enrolling at Northern Illinois University who were not selected for the University Scholars Award. Average qualifications of recipients: Incoming Freshmen-top 5% of class, ACT score of 27 or higher; or Transfer Students-3.5 GPA. Selection is also based on extracurricular activities. Number of awards may vary. Freshmen due date: February 1st and transfer students: March 1st. Award amount covers tuition and $300 per year. Nonrenewable. more...

The Ada B. Drake and Hazel M. Oest Scholarship was established by Roscoe G. Linder to honor his sisters, Ada Drake and Hazel Oest. CRITERIA: Applicants must be full-time students who have attained junior status and have been accepted into the Teacher Education Program in the College of Education; A cumulative grade point average of 3.5 is required and 65 semester hours must have been completed; Because of the demand for good teachers the donor feels that the recipient should be willing to teach for at least two years after graduation. more...

Addictions Scholarship
Are you a full-time college student in the U.S.? Do you have a passion for raising awareness about the dangers associated with substance abuse and addiction?
If you answered “yes” to both questions, you’ll want to enter the Addictions.com Scholarship Contest. Five scholarships will be awarded to qualified college students who write the winning essays (for first, second, third, fourth, and fifth places)
How to Enter
Review Eligibility: Before entering the contest, review the Terms/Conditions requirements and the rules and regulations below to make sure you qualify.
Complete Application: Complete the contest application form below providing all required information.
Submit: Once your essay is written, save as a Word Doc or PDF and submit with your scholarship contest application.
Essay Topic And Guidelines
Essay must be submitted with the application, which should include the author’s name, address, phone number, email address, college (including the date of graduation), and student ID number.
-All entries must be typed, double-spaced, and saved as a Word Doc or PDF.
-Do not add pictures or graphics
-Essays that do not meet the word count requirement will be eliminated. (The essay title or added references / footnotes do not contribute to the total word count.)
-A contestant’s teacher, counselor, or parent may check the essay for punctuation, grammar, and/or spelling, but the essay MUST BE the original work of the student making the submission.
-Contestants will be judged based solely on their essay.
USING YOUR OWN WORDS, PLEASE ANSWER THE FOLLOWING QUESTIONS IN 500-700 WORDS:
-How does substance abuse and addiction affect society today?
-What can we do to reduce the negative effects of addiction, help people access treatment resources, and decrease the burden of addiction on society?
Deadline
Submission Deadline: 1/31/2023
Award Announcement: 2/15/2023 more...

Adult Student Affairs - Pnc Bank Senior Scholarship
Due to the generosity of DePaul University’s partner, PNC Bank, a $5000 scholarship has been established to be awarded to one adult-undergraduate student in each of our nine undergraduate colleges. The award will go to applicants in their senior year of study, with plans to graduate in June or August of 2015.
Please Note: Your application must be completed and submitted online no later than Monday, April 6th, 2015.
Award Criteria:
Currently enrolled undergraduate adult student (at least half-time, minimum 6 credit hours, 24 years and older)
Senior status; graduating in June or August of 2015
Minimum 3.0 GPA

Financial need determined by the results of your 2014-15 FAFSA

Demonstrated commitment to community service
Additionally, there are two letters of recommendation required in order to be considered. You will be asked to provide Name and Email address for each reference in the application process. Your reference will receive a communication guiding them to upload your letter of recommendation. Please be aware that you must manage the submission of these letters. Only applications with both letters of recommendation submitted will be considered.
- Adult Student Affairs more...

Advancing Women In Transportation
The WTS Foundation awards scholarships to women who are pursuing careers in transportation through undergraduate and graduate programs. The scholarships are competitive and based on the applicant’s specific transportation goals, academic record, and transportation-related activities or job skills. Minority candidates are encouraged to apply.
Local Chapters may have additional requirements (such as personal interviews or higher GPA). Please contact your local WTS chapter for more information. All applications are submitted through a chapter.
The chapters submit their nominations for consideration to a Selection Committee composed of Foundation Board members, former Directors, and members. more...

Advocate Health Care Cna Scholarship-Possible Career Opportunity
Advocate CNA Scholarship/Employment Opportunity
This scholarship was funded by Advocate Health Care, a faith-based nonprofit health system in Illinois. In 2018, Advocate Health Care merged with Aurora Health Care of Wisconsin to form Advocate Aurora Health, one of the top 12 not-for-profit health systems in the country. Advocate has 400 sites of care and 10 hospitals.
The Advocate CNA Scholarship/-career opportunity is being offered for the 2022 summer semester to applicants who:
Are planning to participate in the summer 2022 Certified Nursing Assistant program
Meet all eligibility of the CNA program
Must reside in District 502
Submit 250 word (maximum) written statement of career goals and the potential impact of a secure paid position at Advocate on your career
You understand that this can lead to an employment opportunity. Be prepared to be interviewed by a selection committee of representatives from College of DuPage faculty and/or administration, and an Advocate Aurora health
care professional (s). Interviews will occur between June 1-3, 2022.
You have to be prepared to participate in the Wednesday Good Sam clinical section of the COD summer cohort (June 10-July 30, 2022)
Upon the successful completion of the CNA exam, a CNA position. you to agree to a one-year paid position at Good Sam (or alternate Advocate location) first as a Patient Care Companion
Voucher recipients will agree to a one-year paid position at Good Sam (or alternate Advocate location) first as a Patient Care Companion, and upon the successful completion of the CNA exam, a CNA position.
Please note in the application if you will be unable to enroll in the CNA program until you receive scholarship/voucher funding. more...

Alice Giordano Alumni Scholarship
The Alice Giordano Alumni Scholarship recognizes a parent in need of financial aid who meets the eligibility requirements. This scholarship is generously funded by the Alumni Association in honor of Alice Giordano who is a mother, teacher, and College of DuPage instructor. Alice Giordano served as the Coordinator of Child Care and Development from 1985 to 1990, which expanded to include a pre-school and a Day Care Center. Applicants must have a 2.0 GPA or better or higher in every class, be a single parent, have at least one child under 12 years of age living with them, be enrolled in a minimum of 3 credit hours, and have attended two consecutive semesters. Award: $500 more...

First preference given to graduates from Durham Towhnship, IL and secondly to graduates from Hancock County, IL and then to graduates of an Illinois high school. Number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

Alice Irene Gardner Schulze & Irene M. Schulze Wilcox Scholarship
The Alice Irene Gardner Schulze and Irene M. Schulze Wilcox Scholarship was established by William E. Schulze in memory of his grandmother, Alice, and his aunt, Irene.
CRITERIA:
New freshman
Student cannot be granted any other scholarship or scholarships
PREFERENCES:
First preference will be given to a high school graduate or graduates who reside in Durham Township, Hancock County, Illinois. Highest ACT/SAT and GPA will determine recipient if there are multiple applicants.
Second preference will be given to a high school graduate or graduates who reside in Hancock or graduates of a high school in Hancock County. Highest ACT/SAR and GPA will determine recipient if there are multiple applicants.
If there are no recipients who qualify based on first or second preference, the scholarship will be available to any high school graduate or graduates admitted to Western Illinois University. more...

All American Clothing Scholarship
For two decades, All American Clothing Co. has provided countless American families with employment opportunities through local clothing production. We pride ourselves in manufacturing homegrown, high-quality classic apparel, from timeless blue jeans to footwear. This year, we are excited to give back more to the community by supporting a deserving student with our scholarship program.
Scholarship Details
Scholarship Name: All American Clothing $1,000 Scholarship
Deadline: January 12, 2023
Value: $1,000
Available slots: 1
Scholarship Eligibility
-Applicants must be legal residents of the United States or hold a valid student visa.
-Applicants must be currently enrolled to attend an accredited community college, undergraduate, or graduate program within the United States.
-Applicants must be 18 years or older.
How to Apply
-Applicants must write a 1000-word essay discussing this topic: “How do you think buying products made locally can positively impact our country?”
-Essays must be sent to scholarship@allamericanclothing.com as an attached PDF file, including the applicants’ full name, address, contact information, school name, and date of birth.
-Use the subject line: All American Clothing Scholarship | (Your Name)
-Only one submission per person is allowed. You must be able to prove your eligibility based on the above criteria more...

All American Clothing Scholarship
For two decades, All American Clothing Co. has provided countless American families with employment opportunities through local clothing production. We pride ourselves in manufacturing homegrown, high-quality classic apparel, from timeless blue jeans to footwear. With All American Clothing Co.’s motto of “Make Something Happen Today” in mind, we hope to make a meaningful impact by supporting educational endeavors within our community.
Eligibility
Applicants must be legal residents of the United States or hold a valid student visa.
Applicants must be currently enrolled to attend an accredited community college, undergraduate, or graduate program within the United States.
Applicants must be 18 years or older.
Applying
Applicants must write a 1000-word essay discussing this topic: “How do you think buying products made locally can positively impact our country?”
Essays must be sent to scholarship@allamericanclothing.com as an attached PDF file, including the applicants’ full name, address, contact information, school name, and date of birth.
Use the subject line: All American Clothing Scholarship | (Your Name)
Only one submission per person is allowed. You must be able to prove your eligibility based on the above criteria.
To learn more and start your application, click on the Visit button below. more...

Altman & Altman Law School Scholarship
The Altman & Altman Law School Scholarship
Altman & Altman LLP is happy to support student education with our annual Altman & Altman Law School Scholarship. Students who are attending a college or university as an undergraduate or a JD, LLB, or LLM program at a law school in the United States are encouraged to apply.
Scholarship Award:
One (1) scholarship of $ 2,000 will be awarded annually.
Who:
Any current undergraduate or law student in a JD, LLB, or LLM program is eligible for the Altman & Altman Law School Scholarship with a preference to individuals that are (a) from the Boston metropolitan area, or (b) received an undergraduate or graduate degree from a college or university in the Boston metropolitan area, or © are attending a law school in the Boston metropolitan area.
How:
Scholarship applicants are required to do the following:
Fill out a biographical information form.
Write an essay on access to legal services in the United States. This essay should focus on the need and affordability of legal services and propose ideas to help meet the demand of these services. The essay should be at least 1,000 words long.
Email your information form and essay to scholarship@altmanllp.com
Submission Deadline:
Your materials for the scholarship must be submitted between 11/1/2018 and 12/1/2018 to be considered for the scholarship. The winner of the scholarship will be announced on January 15, 2019.
Fill Out Our Application Form on the website more...

Alumnae Association Of Brokaw Hospital School Of Nurses Scholarship Fund

Alumni Acpa Convention
The CSP Alumni ACPA Scholarship was established by alumni of the CSP program. It is awarded to a CSP student who has a genuine interest in becoming involved in the ACPA organization. CRITERIA: Recipient can be a first- or second-year student in the College Student Personnel program who demonstrates a desire to grow professionally through involvement with the ACPA organization. To facilitate this growth, the recipient is required to attend the WIU ACPA Social to meet the alumni contributing to the scholarship and talk with this group about avenues of getting involved with ACPA. Also, the recipient is required to attend one open meeting for an ACPA Standing Committee, Commission, or State Division during the annual convention. more...

Anidjar & Levine Community Service Scholarship
The Law Firm of Anidjar & Levine will award a $2,500 scholarship to the student who best demonstrates the relationship between their community service and future career goals and ambitions. We encourage all students who serve their community to apply for the Anidjar & Levine Community Service Scholarship, and keep giving back to your community!
Eligibility
Students currently enrolled in or formally accepted to an accredited U.S. community college, college, or university undergraduate or graduate degree program
Applicants should have a history of serving their community in a volunteer role.
Applicants must currently be in good academic standing and provide transcripts to support a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or above.
How To Apply
Fill out online application
Current resume listing your community service, including:
Name(s) of the organization(s) through which you volunteered
Service dates
Contact information
Brief description of your service
Your most recent transcript
A 500-word essay on one of these writing prompts:
What job skill(s) did you develop through community service that you did not possess prior to volunteering?
What did community service teach you about leadership?
How has your community service influenced your career goals?
We will select the scholarship winner based on their essay and history of community service.
Notifying the Recipient
Winner will be notified via email by August 2023.
To learn more and start your application, click on the Visit button below. more...

Anuent Global Scholarship
Anuent is excited to announce our Global Scholarship Program! This program is designed to support students from all corners of the globe seeking financial assistance and leadership development opportunities. Scholarships will be awarded to high-performing, talented students pursuing fashion, designing, or related subjects.
Eligibility
You must have completed high school and be enrolled in, or have applied to, a postgraduate or undergraduate course at an accredited college, university or institution
You must have completed at least one term of study in the course
You cannot be a dropout from college, and there must be no gap between your bachelor’s and master’s degree programs
Must have a minimum cumulative grade point average of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale
Be a citizen of the United States, Canada, or Australia
Demonstrate financial need
Be committed to using their skills and knowledge to improve the lives of others in their community
Scholarship funds may only be used for certain expenses, which include tuition, books, and on-campus room and board.
Deadline
The deadline for submissions is April 31, 2023. The winner will be notified individually and announced on or around May 31, 2023.
To learn more and start your application, click on the Visit button below. more...

Anuent Global Scholarship Program
Scholarships will be awarded to high-performing, talented students pursuing fashion, designing, or related subjects.
Scholarship Eligibility
-You must have completed high school and be enrolled in, or have applied to, a postgraduate or undergraduate course at an accredited college, university or institution.
-You must have completed at least one term of study in the course.
-You cannot be a dropout from college, and there must be no gap between your bachelor’s and master’s degree programs.
-Must have a minimum cumulative grade point average of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale.
-Be a citizen of the United States, Canada, or Australia.
-Demonstrate financial need.
-Be committed to using their skills and knowledge to improve the lives of others in their community.
-Scholarship funds may only be used for certain expenses, which include tuition, books, and on-campus room and board
Scholarship Details
-If chosen, you will receive $500 as a scholarship amount
-A bag of your choice from Anuent’s Leather Bags collection
-A journal of your choice from Anuent’s Leather Journals collection
Deadline
The deadline for submissions is April 30, 2023. The winner will be notified individually and announced on or around May 31, 2023.
To apply for a scholarship, please follow the steps below:
Cover letter explaining why you would be an excellent fit for this scholarship.
An essay on “Designing for the Digital Age”
Your academic history including the mark sheets
Add all of the above documents in Google Docs and share the link to the below mail ID
scholarships@anuent.com more...

Approveme.Com Entrepreneur Scholarship
ApproveMe is offering a one-time award scholarship for students pursuing higher education in the United States in the amount of $2,500.00. This scholarship will be offered to a new student each year. Information about eligibility, and requirements is listed below. You can reach out to scholarship@approveme.com with any questions.
Eligibility
Any actively enrolled undergraduate student, or incoming-freshmen with an acceptance letter, attending a US-based college, university, trade school in the fall/winter of 2020.
How To Apply
-In 500-1,000 words, tell us why the concept of entrepreneurship is important to you and how you’d carry that forward in your field of study (whether starting a business, innovating upon industry standards, or evolving new areas within the industry).
-Complete online application
Deadline
December 31, 2022 at 11:59 pm
Notifying Recipients
Winner will be notified on of before February 28, 2023
To learn more and start your application, click on the Visit button below. more...

A successful applicant for the Arditti Risk Management Endowed Scholarship will express a strong interest in pursuing a curriculum to the field of Risk Management such as Finance or Actuarial Science, be ranked in the top 10% of their high school graduating class, and have completed 4 course years of mathematics in their high school curriculum. The scholarship may be renewed if the recipient has maintained a minimum overall cumulative grade point average of 3.0 and earned no grade lower than a B in any mathematics or finance course. more...

Astra Scholarship Program For College & University Students
Get Scholarship Worth $3000 For Cyber Security Enthusiasts
Rejoice, Students! Astra Security is offering Scholarship prize worth $3000.
What You Need To Do
You will have to find a certain threshold of vulnerabilities in the lab provided by us. You will be scored on the basis of which type of vulnerability you have found & its impact on the system.
The scholarship shall be divided among the top 3 students as:
1. $1500 to the Winner
2. $1000 to the 1st runner-up
3. $500 to the 2nd runner-up
The top 2 students of each university/college will also receive a 6-Month Free Subscription to Astra Pro plan worth $144 & Hall Of Fame 🏵️ more...

Automotive Parts And Services Association Of Illinois - Ralph Silverman Memorial Scholarship
This fund is being established by the APSA of Illinois Ralph Silverman Memorial Foundation. Mr. Silverman, the first president of the Association, was a strong advocate of promoting quality and high standards in the automotive aftermarket industry through education. The scholarship is intended to help ensure that the future of the industry is in the hands of the most qualified individuals by providing students from Illinois the funds needed to receive the education required to establish a successful career in the automotive aftermarket.
Scholarship for a full-time student enrolled in the Automotive Technology program who is a legal resident of Illinois.
Preference will be given to a student who submits a letter of recommendation from a representative of an Illinois automotive aftermarket business and a statement discussing career goals and financial need. more...

The B.J. Hoddinott Wildlife Ecology Scholarship assists students interested in pursuing a field of study in Wildlife Biology or Wildlife Ecology in Natural Sciences. Funding for the B.J. Hoddinott Wildlife Ecology Scholarship is generously provided by B.J. Hoddinott, whose philanthropy established the Hoddinott Wildlife Sanctuary on West Campus, the Hoddinott Wildlife Ecology Endowment, and the Marsh Project in addition to this scholarship. Applicants must have a 2.8 GPA or better or higher, have filed the FAFSA for the applicable academic year, be a Natural Science major, and be a full-time student at College of DuPage (12 credits or more) for the applicable semester. Must complete a 3-hour independent study during the scholarship academic year, approved by Hoddinott Project Supervisor or Natural Sciences Dean. If the student fails to qualify for the subsequent semester, funds will revert to the scholarship fund Award: up to $6,000 more...

Ben Hughes Memorial Scholarship
This account was established in memory of Dr. Benjamin (Ben) Hughes. CRITERIA: Have a minimum grade point average of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale (overall and in the Chemistry major), Fill out an application. Preference is given to a Chemistry Undergraduate or Graduate major interested in teaching. more...

Benari Law Firm Digital Marketing Scholarship Program
Benari Law Group is a boutique criminal defense firm operating in the Greater Philadelphia Region, with offices in Media, West Chester, Norristown, and Philadelphia. As the fastest growing criminal defense practice in the county over the past ten years, Benari Law Group strives to be a leader in the field.
Our Criminal Defense Attorneys are leaders in the fight to defend the constitution and the rights of the individual American citizen throughout Delaware County, Chester County, Montgomery County, and Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. We are constantly fighting to ensure the everyday American’s right to be free from unlawful search and seizure and unlawful detention. We fight to preserve the presumption of innocence that lies at the core of our criminal justice system. We fight for the moral administration of justice with a focus on building a future, maintaining families, and providing opportunities for people to succeed in life, despite lapses in judgement that would otherwise cloud otherwise bright futures.
We understand the importance of education and are aware of the fact that education isn’t accessible to everyone. In an effort to help support students who are wish to join the fight for social justice, the Benari Law Scholarship was created to help such students achieve their dreams of becoming impactful in their communities.
To support such students, the Benari Law Group has launched an annual $2,500 Scholarship Program. The Scholarship Program is available to graduate and undergraduate students. International students are also welcome to apply for the program. Scholarship winners will receive the following:
$2,500 toward tuition to further their education.
An opportunity to follow and assist the criminal defense attorneys at Benari Law Group for a limited time (usually a few days to a few weeks, depending on the winner’s preferences) to see the inner workings of the criminal justice system and to get a certificate from the firm that the candidate has completed an immersion program to understand the complexities of how justice works in our great nation.
Coaching time with the founder and managing partner of the firm, Arik T. Benari, Esquire.
How to Apply
Applicants need to write an essay of 1000-2000 words on one of the following topics:
a) How the American Justice system should work compared to how it does;
b) The importance of citizen involvement in a successful democratic society; or
c) Why and how criminal justice is the underpinning of all citizen’s rights in a free society.
Your keys to winning a Scholarship
Creativity
Originality
Accuracy / Grammar 
Understanding of Current Issues
Send the essay to the following email: scholarship@benarilaw.com
You should provide following personal information in the email:
Full Name
Age
Email Address
The name of your University/College, Department/Course
Year of Expected Graduation
GPA
Name and contact information for at least one professor or administrator that can speak to your character as a student and school community member. more...

This scholarship honors Betty and Ron Krupp, longtime volunteers and board member (Betty) of Operation Support Our Troops. The Betty and Ron Krupp Veterans Scholarship is generously funded by Operation Support Our Troops America. Applicants must be enrolled in or admitted to attend College of DuPage, be a United States veteran or the dependent of a veteran (submit a DD214 for verification), file a FAFSA for the applicable academic year, and have and maintain a GPA or better of 2.5 or higher. Applicants must be enrolled in at least 6 credit hours for the applicable semester. Bettye Thompson Scholarship In Gerontology
HISTORY: Dr. Bettye D. Thompson served as a faculty member from 1978 through 1995 and was originally hired as a faculty member in Home Economics now the Department of Family and Consumer Sciences. In 1985 she was named first director of Western Illinois University’s interdisciplinary Master of Arts gerontology program until her retirement in 1995.
This Scholarship was created to recognize her strong work ethic, commitment, and perseverance in the field of Gerontology and to the students who share these qualities; individuals who see the importance of working hard and then putting those skills and knowledge to the good of mankind.
The criteria was revised in September 2015 to reflect an increase in the award amount from $250 to $500.
CRITERIA: Class level: Student must a be at least a Sophomore and have completed at least 9 semester hours of the following: Gerontology 200 Introduction to Gerontology, Psychology 423G Psychology of Adulthood and Aging; and Sociology 405 Sociology of Aging in Rural and Urban America or three semester hours from the approved list of electives.
GPA: Student must have at least a cumulative total GPA of 3.0 and GPA of at 3.0 in the Gerontology minor.
Major/Minor: student must be a declared minor in Gerontology.
Student must be a United States Citizen. more...

Beu Jeans For Scholarships
The concept for Beu Jeans for Scholarships materialized during a Beu staff retreat when an employee requested a jeans day during Homecoming week, and that perhaps employees would contribute something in exchange. Beu employees may contribute $5 on Fridays for the privilege of wearing blue jeans to work, and those contributions support the Beu Jeans scholarship, which assists students preparing to enter the health field.
CRITERIA:
Plan to enter a health-related field (specifically nursing, medical sciences, dietetics, health services, exercise science, athletic training, emergency management, psychiatry, psychology, counseling, social work)
Be enrolled in classes full time (any class level)
Have at least a 2.75 high school or undergraduate cumulative grade point average
Demonstrate financial need
Submit a maximum 500-hundred word essay on interest in a health-related field and plans for the future more...

Big Data Science & Analytics Bi-Annual Scholarship
one of the most in-demand skills on the job market today is data science. Whether writing code for machine learning algorithms or using advanced analytics to determine where to open a new branch, people with the aptitude for harnessing data should continue to have very bright prospects in the workforce, both here in the United States and around the world.
It is estimated by IBM there will 364,000 more data analytics job openings in 2020 than 2019, for a total of 2,720,000. (IBM.com). To fill the gap, employers will look beyond data scientists and fill these jobs with various types of data analysts, engineers, and data and privacy security specialists. IBM also reports demand for data analysts, data scientists and data engineers will grow 39% in 2020.
This scholarship is an ideal way for data science & analytics students to help fund their important educational pursuits in this exciting and evolving field! â€” Jen Hood, Data Analytics Expert and Founder of The Career Force more...

Big East Career Consortium Professional Development Award Application
The intention of the BIG EAST Career Consortium Professional Development Award is to recognize, promote, and aid the career and professional development efforts and needs of students. This award is based on the selection committee’s evaluation of the significance and impact of an applicant’s personal development during their collegiate career. The BIG EAST Career Consortium strives to elevate and enhance the work of the career services organizations of the BIG EAST schools and provide unparalleled opportunities and connections to our students, alumni, and employer partners.
To be eligible for a BIG EAST Career Consortium Professional Development Award, you must be a currently enrolled undergraduate student in good standing here at DePaul University. You must also answer all associated application questions and provide a current resume.
The application deadline for this application is March 4, 2021. more...

Bill Poppei Endowed Scholarship
The William Poppei Endowed Scholarship will be awarded in recognition of outstanding Undergraduate students accepted or enrolled in the Honors Program of the Department of Finance within the Driehaus College of Business. The applicant must submit an online application form, a list of finance courses completed, a list of school based and/or community activities and an essay of no more than 2 pages based on student plans in finance. All applicants must be an accepted finance major and have a 3.9 GPA overall and a minimum of 3.9 GPA in finance courses.
Note : This scholarship is not a cash award. Instead, the entire scholarship amount will be credited to your student account and can only be used to offset tuition.
Applications must be submitted online no later than September 20th 11:59:59 PM CST to be considered more...

Biological Sciences Graduate Student Association Scholar Award
The following criteria must be met:
1. The recipient must be a full-time graduate student of the Biological Sciences Masters program at Eastern Illinois University in good academic standing.
2. The recipient must be a member of BSGSA and be in good standing with the organization according to the BSGSA constitution.
3. Financial need is not a consideration, the award is merit-based.
4. The recipient must have submitted a study plan and thesis outline or provide documentation of a past or future internship, according to the applicants selected Biological Sciences Masters option.
5. A first-year or second-year graduate student of the Biological Sciences Masters program at EIU may apply however precedence shall be given to first-year graduate students enrolled in the program.
6. Eligibility will be based on merit pertaining to involvement in the BSGSA, scholarly or research activities and departmental or campus involvement. Involvement in the BSGSA includes, but is not limited to, assistance in lab manual sales, BSGSA hosted events, and participation in philanthropic activities.
7. The applicant must submit a completed application form, a Curriculum Vitae/resume, and letter of support from a faculty advisor.
8. The applicant must submit a summary of no more than 250 words discussing the need of money and/or the applicant’s achievements.
9. The applicant must submit a projected budget for the use of the funds.
This award is announced in the Spring and disbursed in the Spring. more...

The following criteria must be met:
1. The recipient must be an persistent member of the EIU Campus Democrats (RSO) with a record of involvement in that organization as well as in the local Democratic party and some combination of community and university service.
2. The recipient must be a full-time student enrolled at EIU as a sophomore, junior, or senior with a GPA of 2.8 or higher.
3. Financial need is not a consideration and the recipient may receive the award more than once if he/she continues to meet criteria.
4. The recipient must apply for the award through the prescribed application process, which will include a requirement for providing two letters of recommendation.
5. The award shall be announced in the Fall and paid in the Spring. more...

Blankstyle Scholarship
At Blankstyle.com we realize the importance of education. Our employees range from artists to content writers, and from programmers to customer service representatives. The commonality with our team is great communication hinging on a solid foundation of education. We understand that in today’s economy it is expensive and challenging to obtain a quality education. As we benefit from our educated team here at Blankstyle.com, so does the world in that education equates to a brighter future for all who seek it.
Qualified Applicants
A high school senior that has been accepted to an accredited university or
A current student enrolled in college courses.
Application Requirements
Provide basic background information
Summarize your accomplishments and aspirations
Tell us why you deserve this scholarship and how it will help accomplish your goals
Just for fun tell us how t-shirts have played a role in your life

This account was established in Nov 2013 by a donation from the Piersons. Bob was a Professor at WIU in the College of Education for 30 years, retiring in 1990. He was named teacher of the year in 1978. Donna received her Bachelor of Science in Education in 1965 and her MS-ED in 1979 from WIU. She was a member of the Alpha Sigma Tau Sorority and enjoyed teaching.

Boren Scholarships For Study Abroad
Boren Scholarships allow U.S. undergraduate students to study less commonly taught languages in world regions critical to U.S. interests, including Africa, Asia, Central and Eastern Europe, Eurasia, Latin America, and the Middle East. Students studying in Western European countries, Canada, Australia, and New Zealand are not eligible for Boren awards. Special initiatives exist to study African languages, Indonesian, Hindi, Urdu and Turkish. more...

The winning recipients must be planning to attend EIU during their freshman year in the fall term. The award amount is $1,500 per scholarship and it will show as a credit to the student’s university account for the academic year.
This scholarship is non-renewable.

Brandon Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate student attending Richland Community College full-time. Preference will be given to students who do not qualify for the Federal Pell Grant or the Illinois MAP Grant. Applicant must maintain a minimum 2.75 GPA. Selection is based on financial need and GPA. Award can be applied toward tuition, books or fees. more...

Brandt Consolidated Inc. Scholarships
Scholarship for residents of Illinois who are FFA members and are graduating high school seniors and will be enrolling at the University of Illinois pursuing studies in Agriculture. Students must be U.S. citizens. Criteria used for selection includes students GPA (minimum 2.5), ACT or SAT scores, class rank, leadership in FFA activities, leadership in community activities, and involvement in the Supervised Agricultural Experience Program (SAE). Nonrenewable. more...

2. Minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA

Brankey Scholarship

Brault Modern Languages Study Abroad Fund
The Department of Modern Languages invites you to apply for the Brault Modern Languages Study Abroad scholarship. Awards are available to Modern Languages majors, double majors, and graduate students for fees associated with study abroad. Students applying for this round of awards should be enrolled, or soon to be enrolled, through the Office of Study Abroad in a DePaul Modern Languages long-term language-intensive program or a short-term study abroad program led by at least one faculty member from Modern Languages. All students awarded will be vetted through the Study Abroad Office and Financial Aid prior to the award being processed, and recipients of the award will be asked to provide written and/or video reports of their study abroad experience. Preference for this award goes to students with financial need, and merit may also be considered. Former recipients of an MOL scholarship will not be considered.
For more information about the amounts of each scholarship and how many we’re awarding this cycle, please visit the scholarship section of our website (https://las.depaul.edu/academics/modern-languages/student-resources/Pages/scholarships.aspx), or find us on our social media.
Instagram https://www.instagram.com/depaulmodernlanguages/?hl=en
Facebook https://www.facebook.com/depaulmol/
Note: the scholarship will not post until after the add/drop date in the term the student is traveling. more...

Brian Fugiel Memorial Meteorological Scholarship
The Brian Fugiel Memorial Meteorological Scholarship provides students an opportunity to personally experience storm chasing and thunderstorms. The Brian Fugiel Memorial Scholarship is generously funded by the Family of Brian Fugiel—Carl Fugiel (brother), Sandra Wimmer (mother), and Raymond Fugiel (father). Applicants must be pursuing or intend to pursue Meteorology Education, register for EARTH 1112 or EARTH 2112 (detailed information at weather.cod.edu/chasing), be at least 18 years of age, and file the FAFSA for the applicable academic year. Preference will be given to students demonstrating financial need. Award: $500 more...

Bridging Scholarship For Japan
The Bridging Project offers scholarships to American undergraduate students participating in study-abroad programs in Japan. Funding from private foundations and major U.S. corporations, through donations to the nonprofit US-Japan Bridging Foundation, makes it possible to award about 100 scholarships each year to assist students with the travel and living expenses they will incur while studying abroad in Japan for a semester or an academic year. more...

Bronx Injury Lawyers P.C. Scholarship
Bronx truck accident lawyers are known for getting high settlements for their truck accident clients. We want to help the next generation of Bronx truck accident lawyers pay for their education by awarding an annual $500 scholarship. Our scholarship will be based on a written essay contest with a concentration on truck accident law.
Qualifications
Must be an undergraduate or graduate student enrolled in a U.S. college program, interested in or seeking a law degree.
Essay must contain your name, address, phone number, current major and college.
Email your essay to truckaccidentscholarship@gmail.com.
Must be a pdf.
Deadline is December 31, 2022.
We will announce the winner on our website on January 31, 2022.
Essay Topic
Due to Covid, the U.S. has seen many shortages – one of those shortages being truck drivers. In 2022, the U.S. enacted new laws in an attempt to attract more truck drivers. Some of those laws include the Entry-Level Driver Training (ELDT) rule, allowing those under 21 to be Interstate Truck Drivers, and changes to the Department of Transportation Drug and Alcohol Clearinghouse. Do you think these new regulations will lead to more or less accidents? Why or why not? What would you change, if anything, to these new laws and why?
To learn more and start your application, click on the Visit button below. more...

Brooklyn Injury Attorney P.C. Scholarship
Brooklyn construction accident lawyers are known for getting the best settlement for their construction accident clients. We want to help the next generation of Brooklyn construction accident lawyers fund their education by providing a yearly $500 scholarship. Our Scholarship is based on an essay competition focused on construction accident law.
Qualifications
Must be an undergraduate or graduate student enrolled in a U.S. college program, interested in or seeking a law degree.
Essay must contain your name, address, phone number, current major and college.
Email your essay to constructionlawscholarship@mail.com.
Must be a pdf.
We will announce the winner on our website on January 31, 2022.
To learn more and start your application, click on the Visit button below. more...

Brzozowski Emerging Student Affairs Professional Scholarship
Alana and Jeremy Brzozowski reside in Canada and established this scholarship to provide assistance and recognize the success of a first-year CSP graduate student. CRITERIA: To apply for this scholarship, students must be enrolled in full-time studies at Western Illinois University, pursuing a graduate degree in the College Student Personnel Program. Applicants should be in their first term of the program and must have demonstrated exceptional skills and leadership in their contributions to both the CSP cohort/academic experience and their student affairs practice as they have made the transition into graduate studies. To be considered for the scholarship, students are required to submit an essay explaining their candidacy. more...

Bte Stage Management Scholarship
The BTE Stage Management Scholarship supports students studying stage management through experiential learning in Buffalo Theatre productions. This scholarship is generously provided by Buffalo Theater Ensemble, a nonprofit theatrical company, where students have the opportunity to obtain hands-on experience with professional stage productions. Applicants must be residents of District 502 (College of DuPage’s district); be enrolled in or intend to enroll in THEA 1120, 1823, 2870 and/or 2871. Applicants must include a recommendation from an educator and/or employer to complete the application process. Candidates are responsible for following up with their recommends ensuring responses are submitted prior to the deadline. Final candidates must complete an interview with a panel of reviewers, including the Buffalo Theater Director. Award: $500 more...

4. Financial need is not a consideration.

Bugsnag is proud to offer the $1,000 Careers in Coding Contest for code camp, college, or vocational students who wish to pursue a career in computer engineering and software development. The proceeds of contest are to be applied to the selected student’s educational expenses.
‍
In support of ongoing education, professional goals and improving software for all users, we want to encourage everyone to make an impact through their coding ability and expertise.
The Bugsnag Careers in Coding Contest is limited to computer science, software engineering and development majors, or code camp programs. While we encourage study and learning across all disciplines, we’ve created this contest to help developers hone their craft. If you are passionate about furthering your development career and sharing your expertise with others, we want to hear from you! more...

The CAC Building Scholarship Fund will provide a maximum $1,000.00 scholarship to students
residing in the following counties of Illinois: Boone, Cook, DeKalb, DuPage, Grundy, Kane,
Kankakee, Kendall, Lake, McHenry, Stephenson, Will or Winnebago. The scholarship will be
awarded to a student attending an accredited community college, 4 year college or university.
The scholarship will be based on aptitude and financial need, and may be renewable if he recipient
makes satisfactory progress in a course of study. All persons, irrespective of race, gender, creed
or national origin, who satisfy the eligibility requirements and submit a complete application no
later than July 31st for Fall Semester/ Fall & Winter Quarters, and no later than November 30th for
Spring Semester/ Winter & Spring Quarters. more...

Cadmef Alen Drey Memorial Scholarship
Deadline passed for 2013-14 application cycle. Future tentative deadline is January 31, 2015.
Each year, to honor the memory of direct marketing pioneer Alan Drey, CADMEF awards up to three scholarships to outstanding college students interested in the field of direct or interactive marketing.
The CADMEF Scholarship Committee will review completed applications for final selection. Scholarship awards are distributed directly to the school based on the student’s continued achievement of the required criteria.
Scholarship Awarded:
$1,500 awarded annually to up to three students
Eligibility:
1) Junior or Senior status (community college students welcome)
2) Emphasis in the areas of marketing (direct marketing, interactive marketing or related fields)
Criteria:
1) Academic performance (minimum 2.75 GPA)
2) Involvement in extra-curricular activities with emphasis on organizational involvement
3) Quality of written application
For more information, please visit the link below. more...

Cali Lemon Lawyers Scholarship
Recognized among the top lemon law attorneys in California, Cali Lemon Lawyers by Prestige Legal Solutions, P.C. is committed to assisting the next generation of legal students and future attorneys in succeeding. Here at Cali Lemon Lawyers, we believe that money should never be a deterrent to becoming an attorney. We’re looking for students who demonstrate that they are dedicated to pursuing a career in the legal field. We understand that the decision to pursue a career in law is not the most affordable option. That is why Cali Lemon Lawyers is here to assist and inspire prospective law students who wish to pursue this as a career.
Eligibility
All applicants must be United States citizens or permanent residents.
All applicants must have a cumulative 2.5 GPA or higher.
All applicants must still be enrolled in school and have at least one semester remaining to graduate.
All applicants must participate in the community on a regular basis.
All applicants must submit an application, which includes a 1000-word essay describing their interest in the law field and what they intend to do with their degree after graduation.
You must list any honors or accomplishments that are particularly meaningful to you; three non-academic activities that are important for you; and any academic honors you have earned.
Must submit unofficial transcripts
How to Apply
Download the official Cali Lemon Lawyers Scholarship Application Form.
Applications must be submitted electronically via e-mail to info@calilemonlawyers.com or postmarked by November 1, 2022.
Notifying the Recipient
- Winner will be notified by November 15, 2022
To learn more and start your application, click on the Visit button below. more...

Camras Scholarships
Scholarship for undergraduate students to attending Illinois Institute of Technology. Applicants must have a minimum 3.5 GPA and 1280 SAT or 29 ACT. Applicants must submit admission application and Camras Supplemental Application. Qualified applicants will be invited to attend an interview weekend. Scholarship program recipients will participate in research, internships, projects and entrepreneur opportunities. Award amount varies up to full-tuition. Award is renewable for a total of four years. Contact the Office of Admission for more information and/or application. more...

The Cancer Federation Biological Science Scholarship promotes the study in cancer-related fields and to award scholarships to students who are likely to become future scientists or researchers striving to make a difference in the world, and is funded by Cancer Federation, Inc. Applicants must be full-time students enrolled in the field of Biological Science at College of DuPage. Applicants must write a statement on future goals and community concerns in order to complete the application process, and must submit a transcript (high school or College of DuPage) as highest their GPA or better will be giving consideration. Award recipients must submit a picture and a short biography for publication in the Cancer Federation Journal. Award: $500 more...

Capper And Marilou Grant Paralegal Scholarship
The Capper and Marilou Grant Paralegal Scholarship recognizes, through scholarship, a paralegal student who demonstrated personal and academic growth. Applicants must be enrolled in, or intending to enroll, in his/her final year, imminent to graduation. Applicants must submit an unofficial copy of his/her transcript(s). Applicants must demonstrate academic improvement over a period of time. Applicants must demonstrate extra curricular involvement which arose out of the Paralegal Studies curriculum, or otherwise through other community service or college extra-curricular activity. (Note: LEX induction is not required, but may be a considering factor in the review process.) Applicants must provide an essay (500-750 words; double-spaced, Times New Roman, 12 font), in which s/he, through narrative, describes the growth experience and the impact such growth has, or will have, on his/her future. Recipients will not have received, during the same award cycle, additional paralegal scholarship(s). Award not based on need.
2 awards at $500 each more...

Carl P. Koerner Jr. Scholarship
Established by Jack and Bethina Schultz in memory of Carl P. Koerner Jr., who served as a member of the EIU Board of Trustees, the Koerner Scholarship advances the University’s mission of global citizenship. The award is presented annually to an academically talented international student in a degree program at Eastern Illinois University.
The following criteria must be met:
1. The recipient must be an international student accepted to Eastern Illinois University.
2. The recipient(s) may be eligible to apply for and receive the award again provided he/she continues to meet the criteria stated above.
3. Required essay: Describe a personal experience that highlights the importance of international education at Eastern Illinois University.
(400-500 words)
This award shall be announced in the Fall semester and paid the following Spring semester. more...

Carl Sandburg-Lombard Scholarships
Scholarship for juniors transferring to Knox College. Applicants must have completed an associate degree at Carl Sandburg College in Galesburg, have a minimum 3.5 GPA in a strong liberal arts curriculum and be a U.S. citizen or permanent resident. Number of awards may vary. Renewable. more...

Carlos Hernandez Meritorious Endowed Award For Undergraduate Journalism
Awarded to a talented undergraduate student enrolled in the undergraduate journalism program in the College of Communication, the Carlos Hernandez Meritorious Endowed Award for Undergraduate Journalism provides tuition support for a student planning to accept a paid or unpaid internship in the field of journalism.
Eligibility
Journalism major (preferred) - or - College of Communication major with either a Journalism or Latino Media and Communication minor
Minimum Junior standing (at least 96 hours completed) or above
Minimum 3.0 GPA

Successful completion of two of the four core Communication courses (CMN 101, 102, 103, 104)
Successful completion of at least two Journalism courses
Demonstrated financial need (as indicated by the Office of Financial Aid from a filed FAFSA)
Additional Considerations:
The following criteria may also be taken into account:
Whether a student is Latinx;
A demonstrated a commitment to supporting or working with Latinx communities, including covering issues related to Latinx communities as a journalist;
Dedication to furthering Latinx cultural activities or focusing on Latinx studies at DePaul.
Applicants of the Carlos Hernandez Meritorious Endowed Award for Undergraduate Journalism must secure an approved internship for credit with the College of Communication (CMN) Internship Program for the Fall 2022 term for consideration. Applicants in the CMN Internship Proposal phase are welcome to apply and will be considered. Final award recipient(s) will receive the scholarship applied to the student account after an approved internship and course enrollment is confirmed with the College of Communication Internship Program office. If awardee(s) are unable to secure an approved internship with the CMN internship program for Fall 2022, the scholarship is forfeited.
Please contact Shena Ramsay with questions at sramsay@depaul.edu. For detailed information on the College of Communication Internship Program, visit communication.depaul.edu/internships
About Carlos Hernandez Gomez
The Carlos Hernandez Meritorious Endowed Award for Undergraduate Journalism was established at DePaul University to honor the memory of noted Chicago journalist, Carlos Hernandez Gomez. Known for his trademark fedora and his vast knowledge of Illinois politics, Carlos covered local and national news stories for both CLTV and WBEZ-FM. He died of cancer on January 17, 2010 at the age of 36. Carlos had been a student at DePaul during the mid-1990’s, writing for the The DePaulia student newspaper and working as a disc jockey for WRDP radio (now Radio DePaul) during his tenure. It is the hope of the Carlos Hernandez Meritorious Scholarship in Journalism committee that this scholarship fund will help younger generations of talented DePaul students fulfill their aspirations to enter the field of journalism. more...

Carlson Family Educational Scholarship
Byron Carlson graduated from Western in 1968 with a Bachelor of Business degree and an MBA in 1971.
CRITERIA:
Open to all majors
Full-time enrollment
Minimum 3.25 GPA

Minimum 60 credit hours earned at time of disbursement
Attended Black Hawk College
Demonstrated financial need
Demonstrated record of volunteerism, participation in church related activities, community involvement
Preference to a graduate of Orion High School more...

Carol And Bill Myers Education Scholarship
The Carol and Bill Myers Education Scholarship was created by Carol and Bill Myers. Carol and Bill met while attending WIU in 1968, and married September 5th, 1970. Carol graduated WIU in 1972 with a B.S. in Elementary Education. She also earned a M.S. in Education from NIU. Carol taught second grade in the Schaumburg District 54 and St. Charles Community school district. Clifford (Bill) Myers graduated from WIU in 1971 with a B.S in Industrial Technology and a certificate in Education. He also earned a M.S. in Technology from NIU. Bill helped bring the Lambda Chi Alpha fraternity to campus in 1970. He taught in the Applied Technology Dept. at Hoffman Estates High School and later was the Technology Coordinator at Schaumburg High School. They hope to assist an appropriate recipient with support in achieving their goals to become an educator. more...

Carol Helwig Award
The following criteria must be met:
1. The recipient(s) must be a graduate student(s), working towards certification in or a masters degree in Early Childhood, Elementary, and Middle-Level Education, and accepted to EIU.
2. The recipient(s) must be a non-traditional student, at least 25 years old.
3. The recipient(s) must be a full-time student at EIU.
4. Financial need is a consideration.
5. The recipient(s) shall be eligible to receive the award one time only.
This award is announced in the Fall and disbursed in the Spring more...

Carol J. Grice Major Scholarship
Scholarship for incoming freshmen, transfer students or current undergraduate students attending Western Illinois University who are majoring in Elementary Education. Incoming freshmen must have a minimum ACT score of 25. Transfer students and current undergraduates must have a minimum 3.0 GPA. Number of awards may vary. Renewable. more...

Carol J. Grice Major Scholarship
The Carol J. Grice Major Scholarship was established by Dr. George Grice in honor of his sister, Carol J. Grice Major. CRITERIA: Be enrolled for a minimum of six semester hours, Be an undergraduate student planning to teach at the elementary level at the time the scholarship is awarded, Be a currently enrolled or new transfer student with a minimum 3.0 GPA, or be an incoming freshmen in the top 25% of high school graduating class and have an ACT composite of 25 or higher. more...

Carolyn Kluesner Modglin Memorial Scholarship

1. The recipient(s) must be studying Dietetics or if none are qualified, studying Food and Nutrition.
2. The recipient(s) must be of high moral standing.
3. Financial need will be a consideration.
4. The recipient(s) must have a G.P.A. of 3.5/4.0.
5. The recipient(s) must be a graduate student.
6. The recipient(s) with no other scholarships must get first consideration.

Casa Alumni Constituency Society Scholarship For Isat
Scholarship for a student majoring in information technology, technical resource management, or a successor program.
Recipient must be relative of an SIU graduate with preference given to relatives of CASA, CTC, STC, VTI or other succeeding colleges graduates.
Recipients must be enrolled full-time (minimum of 12 credit hours) for the semester of the award.
First-time applicants will be given priority for awards, but individuals may re-apply every semester of enrollment. more...

Casa Off-Campus Military Scholarship - Automotive
Recipient must be currently enrolled in an off-campus programs in Automotive Technology or its successor and have completed a minimum of 12 semester hours in their major.
Recipient must maintain full-time enrollment in their major through the semester during which the award is granted.
Recipient must maintain a 3.0 or greater in-major GPA.
Recipient must demonstrate financial need.
Applicants must submit two letters of recommendation: one from a current faculty member or employer. The other may not be from a family member, SIUC employee, or student. more...

Catherine M. Brod Scholarship For Speech And Theatre Students
The Catherine M. Brod Scholarship for Speech and Theatre Students supports a second-year member of the College of DuPage Forensics (Speech and Debate) Team who demonstrates commitment and success. This scholarship is generously funded by Catherine M. Brod. Applicants must have a GPA or better of 2.7 or higher, and be a member of the COD Forensics (Speech and Debate) Team. Awardees are expected to participate in non-competitive team activities including but not limited to exhibition performances, judging at high school/home school tournaments fundraising, and community service activities. Applicants are required to submit a statement (250-300) words indicating why they are deserving of this award in order to complete the application process. Award: $2,000 more...

Award amount is up to 50% of tuition. Due date and number of awards may vary. more...

Cbpl Scholarship -- Community And Project Based Learning
The Community and Project Based Learning internship scholarship is awarded to part-time or full-time students in in the College of Liberal Arts and Social Sciences. This award is for both master’s level and undergraduate students. Students in a PhD cohort/track are not eligible to apply. Students performing their internship (paid or unpaid) at DePaul, for a DePaul department, are not eligible to apply. There are multiple scholarships per quarter. During the academic year, this scholarship supports a financial aid award. Students must be enrolled in a credit-bearing class associated with their internship.
This scholarship is intended to support a 10 week, 10 hour/week department-sponsored internship with a domestic or international non-profit, non-governmental organization, or government entity. However, that timing can alter depending on circumstances. The internship, or a portion of the internship, must be project(s)-based and related to the student’s academic skills or interests, designed in collaboration with the internship site, for the benefit of the community or organization. The internship may contain other task-based components, but for this purpose, the student must focus upon the project-based nature of the work. This scholarship is competitive. Students must provide robust answers. Not all academic internships or clinical experiences are project-based and therefore, may not be considered for this award. Students must be in good academic and disciplinary standing and enrolled as part-time or full-time in the quarter in which the internship takes place. Please refer to the website should you have any questions about how to define your project. Students who are completing an internship at DePaul University, with a DePaul University entity, are not eligible for this award.
Please note, the faculty name and email being provided is NOT for a reference letter. This should be the person who can speak to the academic nature of your internship. This faculty (or staff in MSW/MPH) member will be asked about assessment. They must be associated with DePaul. Some units have advisers that handle this, some have chairs/directors, some have faculty/staff point people and some allow faculty at-large to sponsor these academic endeavors. If you are uncertain, please speak with your department chair/director. Failure to obtain the correct point person may result in the dismissal of the application.
Financial need is not a requirement for this award.
Further information on eligibility and requirements are found at https://las.depaul.edu/student-resources/internships/Pages/cpbl-internship-scholarships.aspx
By submitting an application for this award, you certify that you have read the information in its entirety and understand the guidelines.
If the student fails to complete the internship in a satisfactory manner as outlined by the department, the award will be rescinded and the student will owe the university that amount. For this reason, students must be certain they understand the requirements of the internship prior to accepting the scholarship. more...

Central Illinois Typographical Union Local 177 Scholarships
Annual award for undergraduate students attending the University of Illinois-Springfield who are members of or are dependents of a member of an union. First preference given to members/dependents of members of the Central Illinois Typographical Union (CITU) and second preference given to members/dependents of members of any AFL-CIO affiliated union. Applicant must be in good standing, file the FAFSA, have financial need, and write a personal narrative. Renewable. more...

Chaparral Alumni Network Endowed Scholarship Fund

c. Financial need may be a consideration more...

Charlene Callison Scholarship
The Charlene G. Callison Fashion Merchandising Scholarship was established in July 2003 by Dr. Charlene G. Callison and her husband Dr. Larry T. Balsamo. Dr. Callison retired from WIU in the spring of 2004 after 37 years of service in the Department of Dietetics, Fashion Merchandising and Hospitality. When she joined the faculty in 1967 she was one of the youngest members of the faculty in the history of the University. She rose from the rank of instructor in the department to full professor and chair of the department.
Besides teaching hundreds of students over the years, Callison was instrumental in coordinating significant events at WIU, such as former WIU President Ralph Wagoner’s inauguration, Western’s 90th birthday and activities during the University’s Centennial celebration. She created and organized events through her department such as the annual Children’s Shopping Mall in December, and the Occasion to Remember bridal show and numerous special occasion dinners, including etiquette dinners for the WIU and Macomb communities. It was also during her tenure at WIU that she wrote the fashion merchandising curriculum; opened the School Bell Boutique, and oversaw the creation of The Daily Grind Coffee House, a student-run business in Bayliss-Henninger Halls.
Callison graduated from North Texas State University and Texas Women’s University where she received her Ph.D. She started her professional life as a home economics teacher in the Dallas school system, but soon went to New York City where she worked in the fashion industry before coming to Macomb and WIU.
CRITERIA:
∙ Major in Marketing
∙ Minimum cumulative 3.0 GPA
∙ Enrolled full time
∙ Sophomore, Junior, or Senior:
o Must have completed, or be enrolled in MKTG 343: Retailing Management
o Show strong interest and previous involvement in fashion retail more...

Charles A. Elliott Technology Education Award
For juniors, seniors, and graduate students majoring in Career and Technical Education (preferably Technology Education), planning to teach.
Full description:
The following criteria must be met:
The recipient must be a student in good academic standing at Eastern Illinois University and classified, according to the University catalog, as a junior, senior, or graduate student.
The candidate must have a declared major in Career and Technical Education with emphasis in Technology Education.
a. Only if there is no qualified Career and Technical Education with an emphasis in Technology Education applicant, then the recipient must be an undergraduate student or graduate student majoring in one of the technology-related majors offered by the School of Technology accepted to Eastern Illinois University, who plans to pursue a career in technical education (e.g. high schools, vocational centers, community college, universities).
Financial need shall not be considered by the Committee in the selection of the recipient unless all other factors are determined to be equal.
Other reasonable criteria not contrary to the above revisions may be established by the Committee, except that no criterion may be specific grade-point average and no criterion may be such as to discriminate against any candidate.
The recipient(s) may be eligible to apply for the award again provided he/she continues to meet criteria.
This award shall be announced in the Spring and disbursed in the Fall semester. more...

Charles And Elizabeth Huber Education Scholarship
The following criteria must be met:
1. The recipient(s) must be a full-time Sophomore, Junior, or Senior student, majoring in education (Early Childhood, Elementary, and Middle-Level Education or Secondary Education), accepted to Eastern Illinois University.
2. The recipient(s) must be in academic good standing.
3. For the first ten years, the award(s) is to go to a graduate of Unity High School in Tolono, Illinois or Massac City High School in Metropolis, Illinois, or Nokomis High School in Nokomis, Illinois. After ten years, the award(s) may go to a graduate of any Illinois High School.
4. The recipient(s) may be eligible to apply for and receive the award again provided he/she continues to meet the criteria stated above.
This award is to be paid in the Fall semester. more...

Charles B. Arzeni Tropical Biology Fund
The following criteria must be met:
1. The recipient(s) must be a full-time student, majoring in Biological Sciences at Eastern Illinois University.
2. The recipient(s) must be at least a junior with an overall GPA of at least 3.0.
3. The recipient(s) must use the award to travel to the tropics for studies in tropical biology
4. The recipient(s) must display financial need for the award.
5. The recipient(s) must complete a written application for the award.
6. The recipient(s) may receive the award no more than twice.
This award is announced and awarded in the Spring semester. more...

Charles E. And Ferne Tingley Compton Botany Scholarship
The following criteria must be met:
1. The recipient(s) must be a full-time junior or senior student, majoring in Biological Sciences at EIU.
2. The recipient(s) must have chosen the Teacher Certification option or the Botanical Sciences concentration within the Biological Sciences option.
3. The recipient(s) must have an overall GPA of at least 3.0.
4. The recipient(s) should reflect high pedagogical and humanistic traits and values such as those expressed by Ernest L. Stover toward his students during his tenure at the EIU Department of Botany. Specifically, the recipient(s) should exhibit enthusiasm for the study of Botany, dedication to sharing his/her knowledge freely, and willingness to encourage and support others in their intellectual pursuits.
5. The recipient(s) must complete a brief written application for the award in which his/her financial need is demonstrated.
6. The recipient(s) may receive the award only once.
This award is announced and awarded in the Spring semester. more...

Charles R. & Nancy L. Shoemate Scholarship
Charles R. (Dick) Shoemate and his wife Nancy created this scholarship because they believe it is important that our citizens have the ability to think logically and critically. This scholarship is a dedication to Dick and Nancy and their lives, and to the students who share these qualities: individuals who see the importance of working hard to achieve an education and then putting those skills and knowledge to the good of mankind. CRITERIA: Physics major with preference to a student pursuing a teaching career in physics, Must be at junior class level or a transfer student, Minimum 3.0 GPA, Demonstrate potential to be a leader in the field and have a commitment to teaching. Preference will be given to students who are an underrepresented minority in Physics with financial need and an expressed desire to pursue a teaching career in physics at the secondary or university level. more...

Chef Ollie Sommer Scholarship
The Chef Ollie Sommer Scholarship is available to full-time students at Southwestern Illinois College. Chhs Alumni Constituency Society Scholarship For Automotive Technology
Recipient must be a relative of an SIU graduate with preference given to relatives of CASA, CTC, STC, VTI or other succeeding colleges graduates.
Recipients must be majoring in Automotive Technology or its successor.
Recipients must be enrolled full-time (minimum of 12 credit hours) for the semester of the award.
Applicants must provide documentation showing good academic standing such as previous college transcripts, GPA, or ACT composite scores.
First-time applicants will be given priority for awards, but individuals may re-apply every semester of enrollment. more...

Chhs Alumni Constituency Society Scholarship For Health Sciences

Recipient must be relative of an SIU graduate with preference given to relatives of CASA, CTC, STC, VTI or other succeeding colleges graduates.
Recipients must be enrolled full-time (minimum of 12 credit hours) for the semester of the award.
First-time applicants will be given priority for awards, but individuals may re-apply every semester of enrollment. more...

1. 3.5 or higher Cumulative GPA
2. Must be taking RE courses during the 2021-2022 academic year
3. Must be in good academic standing
4. Must Show Financial Need
Eligibility: Consideration for this scholarship shall be given to undergraduate or graduate students in Real Estate. Preference may be given to students who have financial need and demonstrate academic merit. Additional consideration may be given to a student who is from a population that is underrepresented in the field of real estate, or who demonstrates an interest in or commitment to working with underrepresented populations. more...

Chicagoland Community College Transfer Scholarship
Consideration for these scholarships shall be given to transfer students from a Chicago City College or a qualifying Chicagoland Community College who have earned an Associate degree and will be entering DePaul as a full-time student at the junior level. Applicants must have a cumulative GPA from their associate degree institution of 2.5 or above and have demonstrated financial need. This scholarship is renewable for recipients’ senior year as long as recipients continue to maintain a GPA of 2.5 or above. The donor is excited to support Chicago-based community college students in completing their education at DePaul University.
(all eligible Community and City Colleges listed below)

Chief Helms/Chief Frankie Memorial Scholarship
ELIGIBILITY
1. Available to continuing college students
2. Minimum 2.50 cumulative GPA
3. Fire Science Technology program of study
4. Enrolled in a minimum of 3 credit hours
5. Must be a paid or volunteer firefighter
