Children Of Veterans Scholarships
Scholarship for children of veterans, who reside in one of the 102 counties in Illinois and who attend or will attend the University of Illinois at any of its campuses -- Urbana-Champaign, Chicago, Health Sciences Center, or Springfield. Scholarship recipients must be one of the following; child of deceased veteran, child of disabled veteran, child of living veteran who is not disabled. Parent must be a veteran of the U.S. Armed Forces and must have served between the specified dates or received the specified medal for the following wars: World War II, Korean Conflict, Vietnam Conflict, or the Southwest Asia Conflict (Service Medal). Up to four students (one per war/conflict) are chosen from each county in Illinois. Applicants must be admitted to the U of IL and must submit: completed application, proof of parents service in the U.S. Armed Forces, proof of service dates and receipt of appropriate medal if applicable, and ACT scores. Applications will be available December 1. Contact Office of Student Financial Aid for further information and application. more...

Additional consideration may be given to students from a population that is underrepresented in Finance or those who demonstrate an interest in or commitment to working with underrepresented populations. Preference may also be given to students who exhibit financial need. more...

1. The recipient(s) must be a full-time student accepted to Eastern Illinois University majoring in Family and Consumer Sciences studying
Hospitality Management.
2. Must be in good academic standing.
3. Financial need is not a consideration.
4. The recipient(s) may apply and receive the scholarship one additional time provided he/she continues to meet all the criteria herein.
5. The award shall be announced in the Fall semester and paid in the Spring semester.
4. Recipient(s) shall be eligible to apply for, and receive, the award one additional time provided she/he continues to meet the criteria
stated above since first receiving the award. more...

Chronic Illness Scholarship
This scholarship is for the 2022–2023 Academic Year.
We are pleased to inform the DePaul University community of a scholarship opportunity for the 2022-2023 Academic Year. The Chronic Illness Scholarship seeks to assist undergraduate students with chronic illness who show courage and character on a continuous basis in their daily lives and a sincere desire to continue their education with the capacity for success.
Eligibility Requirements:
• Students must be registered with DePaul’s Center for Students with Disabilities at time of submission.
• Students must be enrolled as an undergraduate in the current 2022-2023 Academic Year at DePaul.
• Students must obtain two letters of recommendation addressing the student’s capacity for college-level work and his or her courage and character. One of the letters, preferably, should be from the student’s instructor/professor, present or past.
• Students must submit a personal statement/letter with a brief chronology and description of the student’s illness and what the student has done to develop his or her mind and character since becoming ill.
• There must be evidence of financial need.
• The student’s illness must be chronic, i.e., there is no certainty that symptoms will cease over the next three or more years.
• The finalist may be asked to participate in a phone interview.
To apply for this Scholarship Opportunity you must complete the following steps:
1. If you have not done so already, complete the General Application on DePaul Scholarship Connect:
a. Log into the DePaul Scholarship Connect using your Campus Connect ID and password.
b. Complete and submit the General Application.
i. Your General Application will be marked with a green checkmark to indicate that it has been completed and submitted successfully.
ii. If it is gray, the application was not submitted successfully; try again.
2. After submitting the General Application, you can search the scholarship by typing the name or by using any keyword in the name in the search bar.
3. Click on the blue “Apply” button next to the application name. Additional questions or information may be required to complete the application process.
After Submitting an Application:
You can monitor the status of your application by logging in to your dashboard on DePaul Scholarship Connect.
PLEASE NOTE: To be considered for this scholarship, completed applications, including letters of recommendation, must be submitted by Tuesday, May, 31st, 2022. Sending reference requests online will not inform your references of the application deadline, it is your responsibility to directly inform and maintain communications with your reference(s) of the deadline.
A decision will be made by the end of June 2022.
For additional information on requirements for this scholarship or on the scholarship application process, please contact ofascholarships@depaul.edu or Greg Moorehead at GMOOREHE@depaul.edu. more...

Cme Group Foundation Scholars Program For African American And Latino Students In 4+1 Ms Finance Degree Program
CME Group Foundation has established a scholarship program to assist African American and Latino students who are current or rising undergraduate sophomores, juniors or seniors or rising juniors, seniors, or graduate students enrolled in the 4+1 MS Finance degree program.
This program is administered by Scholarship America®, the nation’s largest designer and manager of scholarship, tuition assistance and other education support programs for corporations, foundations, associations, and individuals. Awards are granted without regard to creed, religion, sexual orientation, gender, disability, or national origin.
Eligibility
Applicants to the CME Group Foundation Scholars Program must be:
African American or Latino;
A current or rising undergraduate sophomore, junior or senior student (students enrolled in a 4+1 MS Finance degree program are eligible, but must be a rising junior, senior or graduate student in the 4+1 MS Finance program);
Enrolled or planning to enroll full-time at one of the following CME Group Foundation partner schools for the entire upcoming academic year:
Partner Schools:
DePaul University
St. Xavier University
Illinois Institute of Technology
Northern Illinois University
Loyola University Chicago
National Louis University
University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign
Stevens Institute (Hoboken, NJ)
Majoring in:
Information Technology
Computer Science
Finance
Data Science
Cyber Security
Math
Statistics
Financial Engineering
Have a minimum grade point average of 2.5 on a 4.0 scale (or its equivalent);
Willing to attend a one-day market education program at CME Group in Chicago in August 2019 to learn about the industry and summer internship opportunities. Recipients will be reimbursed for travel expenses for the day;
Awards
If selected as a recipient, the student will receive up to $20,000. Up to twenty-five (25) awards will be granted. Award amounts may vary based on financial need.
Awards may be renewed until a bachelor’s degree (or a 4+1 MS Finance degree) is earned on the basis of continued full-time enrollment and satisfactory academic performance.
Awards are for undergraduate study only with the exception of the 4+1 MS Finance degree. Awards may be used for all education-related expenses.
Application Process
Start by clicking Register to Apply at the bottom of this page. You must read and agree to a consent statement, supply a unique and valid email address, and create a username and password.
Correspondence throughout the application process will be by email. Email messages will be sent to the username and email address registered when you created your account. Be sure to add cme-scholars@scholarshipamerica.org to your contacts or address book and check your email regularly!
Complete the application by entering data in the format described. Proper punctuation and standard capitalization (Jill Smith, 10 Main Street, New York, NY) must be used.
During the application process, you may leave the site prior to submission by clicking Save and Log out.
Once all application requirements are satisfied, Lock and Submit will be available near the bottom of the Review Application page.
Carefully review your application before clicking Lock and Submit. Once submitted, you will no longer have access to your application.
It is recommended that you keep a copy of your application for your records.
You will receive an email acknowledgment of your submitted application.
Required Documents
As part of your application, you must upload the following document:
Current, complete transcript of grades. Grade reports are not accepted. Unofficial or online transcripts must display student name, school name, grades and credit hours for each course, and term in which each course was taken.
Your application is not complete unless all required documents are submitted electronically.
Program Deadline
Your application must be submitted on or before 3:00 p.m. Central Time on Thursday, March 28, 2019.
Selection of Recipients
Scholarship recipients are selected on the basis of academic record, demonstrated leadership and participation in school and community activities, work experience, statement of career and educational goals and objectives, unusual personal or family circumstances, and an additional essay on the topic: Why are you interested in a career in the financial services industry?
Recipients must demonstrate financial need.
Selection of recipients is made by CME Group Foundation. All applicants agree to accept the decision as final.
Notification
Applicants will be notified in late May. Not all applicants to the program will be selected as recipients. Students may reapply to the program each year they meet eligibility requirements.
Payment of Scholarships
Scholarship America processes scholarship payments on behalf of CME Group Foundation. Payments are made in one installment in early August.
Obligations
Recipients have no obligation to CME Group Foundation. They are, however, required to notify Scholarship America of any changes in address, school enrollment, or other relevant information, and to send a complete official transcript when requested.
Revisions
CME Group Foundation reserves the right to review the conditions and procedures of this scholarship program and to make changes at any time including termination of the program.
Contact Us
Email: cme-scholars@scholarshipamerica.org
Call: 1-507-931-1682 and ask for the CME Group Foundation Scholars Program more...

Cogburn Law Offices Annual Scholarship
Cogburn Law Offices, located in Las Vegas, Nevada, offers a broad range of services, with an emphasis on personal injury and consumer law. We understand the increasing costs of college tuition is making it more difficult to obtain a college degree for many outstanding students across the nation.
Therefore, every year we offer a $5,000 scholarship to the student who submits the winning essay or video demonstrating how he or she has overcome great personal adversity. more...

College Book Stores Of America Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate student attending Richland Community College full-time. Preference given to applicants who do not qualify for the Federal Pell grant or the Illinois MAP Grant. Applicant must have a minimum 2.5 GPA. Award amount covers books up to $200. more...

College Monk Short Essay Scholarship
The College Monk $1,500 No-Essay Scholarship is a scholarship with no GPA requirements. The purpose of the scholarship is to provide financial assistance to high school graduating students or college students who are going to attend an accredited institution in the US. The scholarship is awarded once each year and is available to all eligible students regardless of ethnicity, national origin, or immigration status.
Eligibility
Open only to those legal residents of the fifty (50) states of the United States and the District of Columbia or be an international student with a valid visa and should be thirteen (13) years of age or older at the time of application and are currently enrolled (or enroll no later than the fall of 2021) in an accredited post-secondary institution of higher learning (college, university or trade school) unless specified differently.
How To Apply
Submit a complete scholarship application online at the Sponsor’s Website
Notifying the Recipient
Winner will be notified via email after January 31, 2023.
To learn more and start your application, click on the Visit button below. more...

College Of Communication Graduate Assistant Application
The College of Communication is hiring one additional graduate assistant for the Spring 2022 quarter to serve as a teaching assistant in CMNS 280 Introduction to Digital Skills with Dr. Sam Close. Selection will be based on a combination of interest, current GPA, applicable background/skills in the subject matter, and seniority. The chosen GA will receive a tuition waiver for one, 4-hour graduate communication course ($3,100), and a $1,500 monetary stipend during the Spring Quarter. The GA will work about 10 hours per week (100 hr/quarter). Schedule will be determined with the GA supervisor.
To be eligible for a graduate assistantship you must meet all of the following requirements.
Requirements:
By the quarter the student serves as a GA, they will have been a graduate student in the College of Communication for a minimum of 2 quarters and have completed at least 3 courses while part of their graduate program.
Must be registered for at least 1 course when serving as a GA
Have a 3.5 cumulative GPA or above
Have experience in most of the following digital skills: photography & video with a DSLR camera, basic photo editing with Photoshop, audio recording, audio editing with Audacity or Audition, video editing with premiere, chart/graph creation with Illustrator, very basic coding with Scratch. Ideally the candidate would be comfortable with all or most of these skills and willing to pick up the ones they are less familiar with in order to help students.
Full-time DePaul employees are not eligible
Examples Teaching Assistant responsibilities
Attending a digital skills-related undergraduate course.
-CMNS 280 Introduction to Digital Skills, Monday/Wednesday, 11:50am-1:20pm, Loop Campus, Dr. Sam Close
Helping the instructor with grading
Teaching a class if the instructor asks
Answering questions for students
Assisting the instructor with other duties as assigned
Serving as a graduate ambassador to prospective students
You will need to upload an unofficial transcript, resume, and brief personal statement that explains your interest in the graduate assistantship and the skills and experience you can bring to the position.
**Deadline to apply is Wednesday, February 23, 2022 more...

When students apply for a Scholars Award, they are evaluated based on their cumulative GPA and their answer to the Scholars Award essay question. To be eligible for a Scholars Award, applicants must be a 2021-2022 District 502 high school graduate or District 502 resident.

College Of Education Graduate Assistant Application - Department Of Educational Policy Studies And Research
Graduate assistantships are opportunities for qualified students to work closely with faculty members, to support on-going research efforts and to engage in on-going conversations regarding educational issues and research with faculty and other student colleagues. You must apply separately to each department/program you are interested in working with. Graduate Assistant applicants are interviewed and appointed directly by each individual hiring area in the College of Education. Applicants are typically contacted for follow up mid May-mid June. Official offers extended in August.
If you have general inquiries, not department or program specific, please contact: Nicole Nudo at nnudo@depaul.edu. more...

College Of Las Undergraduate Research Fund
Applicants must read the Student Guidelines before completing an URF application: https://las.depaul.edu/student-resources/undergraduate-research/Documents/URFStudentGuidelines.pdf. By applying you certify that you understand the guidelines.
The Undergraduate Research Funding (URF) supports DePaul undergraduate students in their pursuit of research and scholarship. The program allows undergraduate students to receive funding for planning, implementation, and dissemination of research and scholarship at locations beyond DePaul, including virtual conferences. Providing financial assistance for conducting and presenting research at professional and academic conferences enhances the learning experiences of our students. This funding contributes to students’ overall academic experience, and more effectively meets the needs of undergraduate education.
Students may apply for funding to attend an academic conference before submitting to or being accepted by a particular conference. This pre-approval process allows a student to determine if a given trip would be feasible with or without URF Funding. (See the FAQs for more information about reimbursement policy and procedures.)
*The guidelines below address typical circumstances. As students prepare an application and speak or correspond with their faculty sponsor, the current restrictions above must be understood to modify the guidelines.
The Executive Associate Dean in LAS will approve applications. Criteria include:
• A clear and complete project description outlining the applicant’s project as it will be presented. This will typically be the conference “abstract” or “proposal” rewritten for a non-specialist audience.
• A brief but full statement of the relationship of the opportunity to the applicant’s professional development and undergraduate-level learning.
• Proof of Selection: Verified acceptance to present at an academic conference.
• A clear and complete budget form and budget narrative in the format specified (see FAQs for more information). If a budget and budget narrative are not submitted, the application will be denied.
• The endorsement of a full-time faculty member familiar with the student’s ongoing academic work
• Equitable distribution of available funding, to include special consideration of first-time applicants
Travel Registration
Students are required to register international and non-local domestic overnight travel for DePaul purposes in the Global Engagement Travel Registration database.”
Travel Registration Information: https://offices.depaul.edu/global-engagement/student-resources/Pages/travel-registration.aspx
Travel Registration Application: https://programsabroad.depaul.edu/index.cfm?FuseAction=Programs.ViewProgram&Program_ID=10070
Travel advisory countries/regions: https://programsabroad.depaul.edu/customtags/ct_FileRetrieve.cfm?FileID=54820
URF as a Singular Source of Funding
In rare cases, students apply to multiple sources of funding for the same trip. This includes funding sources (department or career center awards, grants, fellowships, etc.) that are internal and external to DePaul. This practice is allowed, but the URF requires that you disclose this information in your application. Acceptance of a URF award shall be understood as confirmation that the applicant has not already received full funding for the same request from another source and will not submit for reimbursement charges that will be covered by another funding source.
https://las.depaul.edu/student-resources/undergraduate-research/Pages/grant-programs.aspx more...

College Resource Network Scholarship Catalogue
Our mission at College Resource Network is to provide you with the best college resources and information available on the internet. We provide you with useful resources and college planning tools so you can make informed decisions about your college education.
To view this organization’s available scholarships, click the Visit button below more...

College Scholarships.Org Scholarship Catalogue
As the recipient of financial aid during my college years, I know every last dollar helps. Back in 1998, when I was a college freshman, I received Stafford Loans and Pell Grants. I didn’t search for other funding opportunities because I did not know they existed. Due to financial concerns and family issues I had to drop out.
Our original site was launched in 1999. Due to its popularity, we rebranded as College Scholarships.org on May 29, 2007. Students can now search via the internet to find innumerable financial aid opportunities. Students can browse through funding options for certain health conditions, sports, majors, minorities, religions, and military service among other categories. College Scholarships.org gives students the information they need as quickly as possible.
To view this organization’s available scholarships, click the Visit button below more...

Collegeboard Scholarship Catalogue
College Board is a mission-driven not-for-profit organization that connects students to college success and opportunity. Founded in 1900, College Board was created to expand access to higher education. Today, the membership association is made up of over 6,000 of the world’s leading educational institutions and is dedicated to promoting excellence and equity in education.

Comed Scholars Program Application
YOU MUST BE AN INCOMING FRESHMAN FOR THE 2022-2023 ACADEMIC YEAR TO APPLY FOR THIS SCHOLARSHIP
The ComEd Scholarship was established to provide recognition and financial assistance to high-potential incoming DePaul University students with financial need. Preference will be given to students who were ComEd Scholars at DePaul College Prep. Secondary preference shall be given to students who graduated from DePaul College Prep and are majoring in the below STEM majors. The award is renewable for four years for students who remain in good academic standing and meet the requirements of the ComEd Scholars program.
• Accountancy
• Computer Science
• Cybersecurity
• Economics
• Finance
• Geography
• Information Systems
• Information Technology
• Management Information Systems
• Mathematics and Computer Science
• Network Engineering and Security
If selected, you are committing to the following program requirements:
Participating in a mentorship program once a month with a ComEd professional (Saturdays; January – May)
Applying for a summer internship with ComEd or its parent company Exelon; or its network of suppliers during your tenure at DePaul University
Engaging in ComEd/Exelon events and communicating with the ComEd Scholars Program Manager more...

Communication And Media Graduate Assistantship
The Communication and Media MA Program is looking for students who are interested in being graduate teaching assistants for the Fall, Winter and/or Spring Quarters of the 2021-2022 Academic Year. Several positions are available, but applications are competitive. Positions may involve teaching or research related duties, at the discretion of their assigned Faculty member. Students who are selected for a GA position will receive a tuition waiver for one course ($3,100) in each quarter of the assistantship, as well as a quarterly stipend of $1,500. You would be expected to work about 100 hours per quarter.
Eligible students must:
• Be a current Communication and Media graduate student.
• Have completed at least 2 courses (8 credit hours) in the MA in Communication and Media Program prior to the start of Fall Quarter 2021
• Be enrolled in at least 4 credit hours during each quarter of the assistantship
• Be available in any of the Fall, Winter or Spring quarters (or specify which quarters you are available if not able to work during any of the three).
· *Students who are full time employees of DePaul University are not eligible.
Most graduate assistant (GA) positions are for one quarter. The GA will also hold responsibilities as the Graduate Communication Student Ambassador of the program and interact with prospective students.
To apply, students will need to upload an unofficial transcript, resume, and brief personal statement (statement guidelines below).
In a 500-word statement, please address the following:
- Explain why you’d like to be considered for a teaching or research assistantship and what aspects of your role as a graduate student are likely to positively influence your experience.
- Describe what personal qualities and work/volunteer experiences have prepared you for a teaching-related role in the classroom.
- Describe those educators who’ve positively influenced you and how you might try to incorporate those qualities in your own teaching.
- Describe what research skills and methodologies you are experienced in that you might bring to a research assistant role.
- List two faculty members here at DePaul that can comment about your preparedness as a graduate assistant.
Deadline: June 21st, 2021 more...

Communication Studies Talented Student Award
This is a tuition waiver to provide financial assistance to students with academic talent or special status; fees are not waived.
The following criteria must be met:
Undergraduate Students:
1. The recipient(s) must maintain a cumulative GPA of 3.00, or 3.00 GPA in high school, admitted to Communication Studies.
2. The recipient(s) shall demonstrate proficiency of some unique talent or skill that can benefit the department.
OR
The recipient(s) shall participate in a University or department priority activity.
OR
The recipient(s) shall be selected by a faculty panel to receive a scholarship or other award.
OR
The recipient(s) shall have won or placed in a departmentally sponsored contest.
3. The recipient(s) must provide:
- Three letters of reference from individuals outside of the Communication Studies department who can attest to a student’s academic abilities.
OR
- One letter of recommendation authored by a departmental faculty.
Graduate Students:
1. The recipient(s) must be a Graduate student admitted to/enrolled in one of the CMN graduate programs:
Communication & Leadership
Communication Processes
Communication Studies
Communication Pedagogy
2. The recipient(s) must be a Full-time student. (9+ hours as a Graduate student).
3. The recipient(s) must maintain a 3.0 graduate GPA (after the first semester).
4. The recipient(s) shall demonstrate proficiency of some unique talent or skill that can benefit the department.
OR
The recipient(s) shall participate in a University or department priority activity.
OR
The recipient(s) shall be selected by a faculty panel to receive a scholarship or other award.
OR
The recipient(s) shall have won or placed in a departmentally sponsored contest.
According to EIU’s Internal Governing Policy #73, this award is a “Tuition waiver to provide financial assistance to students with academic talent or special status; fees are not waived.” Therefore, students who already have a full tuition waiver or have no room in their financial aid package for tuition assistance are not eligible to receive this award. more...

Computerscience.Org Scholarship Catalogue
According to the Institute for College Access and Success, college graduates held an average of $28,950 in student loans in 2019. Student debt can burden borrowers for years, even with recent policies and programs intended to help lighten the load. For example, income-driven repayment plans can lower graduates’ monthly payments, but it may still take 20-25 years to pay off the debt.
Our guide below lists computer science scholarships. These opportunities can help computer science students reduce educational costs. This guide also explores the overall financial aid process to help prospective students plan their education with confidence.
To view this organization’s available scholarships, click the Visit button below more...

Conference Of Women Legislators Of The Illinois General Assembly

Congress Bundestag Exchange For Young Professionals (Cbyx) - Study Abroad
CBYX is a fully-funded fellowship funded by the German Bundestag and U.S. Department of State, that annually provides 75 American and 75 German young professionals between the ages of 18-24 the opportunity to spend one year in each other’s countries, studying, interning, and living with hosts on a cultural immersion program. The program consists of three phases: Two months of intensive German language training, four months of classes in one’s academic or career field at a university, technical or professional school, and five-month internships in one’s career field. more...

Credit Sesame
Our scholarship is called ‘The Financial Literacy Scholarship’ because our mission is to empower young adults to take charge of their credit and financial health. Twice per year, we award a student with a $2,500 scholarship to further their educational goals.
To apply, students must meet the following eligibility requirements:
• Deadlines: October 30th and April 30th every year
• Open to all majors
• Must be enrolled at an accredited 2-year, 4-year, or technical/vocational college or university in the United States.
• Open to college undergraduates, graduate students, and professional students
• Must be a United States citizen or permanent resident
• Must have a minimum 3.0 GPA more...

Critical Languages Scholarship - Study Abroad
The Critical Language Scholarship (CLS) Program is an intensive overseas language and cultural immersion program, designed to promote rapid language learning for American students. CLS participants spend the summer abroad on this fully-funded scholarship program. CLS is part of a wider government initiative to expand the number of Americans studying and mastering foreign languages that are critical to national security and economic prosperity. more...

Crown Scholarship
Scholarship for incoming freshmen admitted to Illinois Institute of Technology and are majoring in Architecture. Applicants must have a minimum 3.5 GPA, 1280 SAT or 29 ACT, be in the top 10% of their high school graduating class, have participated in extracurricular activities and be a U.S. citizen or permanent resident. In addition to application, students must submit a one-page essay, freehand original drawing, and letter of recommendation. Admission application and Crown Scholarship Application must be submitted to the Office of Admission by January 12. Finalists will be invited to interview during Scholarship Weekend. Award amount covers full tuition. Awards are renewable for a total of five years. Contact the Office of Admission for more information and/or application. more...

Established in 1999 by distinguished alum Dan Webb, who was selected by National Journal as one of the “100 Most Influential Lawyers in the US.” CRITERIA: Be political science majors, Have completed junior status, Have completed at least 12 hours of political science classes, Hold at least a 2.75 GPA, Be in good judicial standing, Applicants will meet the normal requirements for Political Science 402, which include: Completing 100 hours of work (for three hours credit) at the designated job site, Keeping a journal documenting both hours worked and reflections, Completing a reading assignment, to be determined by the faculty supervisor, Writing a paper on a topic related to the internship, Giving a presentation to her/his peers about her/his experiences during the following Fall semester, as a recruiting opportunity for future interns. Each recipient will need to register for Political Science 402, and will be supervised by the Department Chair or relevant faculty member. more...

Daughters Of The American Revolution
The NSDAR awards multiple scholarships to students showing dedication to the pursuit of degrees in diverse disciplines including history, law, nursing, and education.
The DAR Scholarship Committee awards scholarships to qualified applicants regardless of race, religion or sex. All applicants must be United States citizens. All multi-year scholarships, typically renewable up to four years, must be for consecutive years of attendance at an accredited college or university in the United States. The only exception is the American Indian Scholarship that is available for students pursuing vocational training. more...

David L. & Audrey Jorns Business Education Scholarship
For juniors/seniors in Career and Technical Education (Business Education), whose employment covers half of college costs. Requires 3.3 GPA.
Full description:
The following criteria must be met:
It is to be awarded to a Junior or Senior Career and Technical Education major with a Business Education emphasis in good standing with an overall grade-point average of at least 3.3.
The scholarship is to be awarded to a Career and Technical Education major with a Business Education emphasis who contributes at least half of the cost of his/her university education through his/her own employment.
Eighty percent (80%) of the annual proceeds from the interest on the corpus of the scholarship are to be used for tuition, fees, and books. Twenty percent (20%) is to be returned to the corpus.
This award is announced in the Spring and disbursed in the Fall. more...

Ddrb Lawyers Legal Scholarship
The DDRB Lawyers Legal Scholarship by Dolan Dobrinsky Rosenblum Bluestein, LLP is a recurring scholarship worth $1500 designed to help one law student with their tuition costs. We welcome all eligible students to apply and look forward to reviewing your application.
Application Deadline: Jan 31, 2023
The winner will be announced on or before Mar 31, 2023.
Eligibility Requirements
You must be admitted to OR have received an acceptance letter from an accredited law school in the U.S.
3.5 or higher current cumulative GPA. If you are an incoming 1L student, we will accept your undergraduate cumulative GPA. If the law school you’re attending uses a pass-fail binary grade system, then we will accept a “pass” grade.
Application Requirements
Completed Application. Incomplete or late applications will not be considered.
Upload a 400-500 word original essay on what you hope to achieve in your legal career if awarded this scholarship.
Upload an Unofficial School Transcript. Unofficial transcripts do not need to be sealed, and can be uploaded as a PDF below.
Upload Resume.
Please do not call the firm regarding the scholarship. Failure to follow these simple instructions will result in your disqualification. If you have questions that are not answered above, please email ddrblawyers@gmail.com, and we will respond to you as soon as we can. Thank you for your interest and good luck!
To learn more and start your application, click on the Visit button below. more...

He went on to teach at Macomb High School where he shared his passion for the foreign languages with students during his long tenure as a high school educator.
CRITERIA:
Incoming freshman
First preference to a Macomb High School, IL graduate, 2nd preference to a McDonough County, IL high school graduate, 3rd preference to an Illinois high school graduate
Major: First preference to a foreign languages major, 2nd preference to a foreign language minor, 3rd preference to an individual with an expressed interest in foreign languages. In all cases, preference is to be given to students studying Spanish.

Deloitte Foundation Scholarship For Students With Disabilities
This scholarship is for the 2022-2023 Academic Year.
The purpose of this scholarship is to provide recognition and financial assistance to students with disabilities who are enrolled in the Driehaus College of Business.
Eligibility Requirements:
• Students must be registered with the DePaul University Center for Students with Disabilities (CSD) at the time of submission.
• Students must be enrolled as undergraduates in the Driehaus College of Business in 2022/2023 and must be in good academic standing.
• Students must reach at least junior status by the end of the 2022/2023 academic year.
• Preference may be given to declared Accounting/MIS majors and students with financial need (as determined by the FAFSA), but all eligible Driehaus College of Business students are encouraged to apply.
Application Process:
• Students complete the application, which includes a short, typed essay.
• Applications will be reviewed by a committee made up of representatives from the Center for Students with disabilities, the Driehaus College of Business and the Office of Financial Aid. This scholarship committee will decide on two recipients.
To apply for this Scholarship Opportunity you must complete the following steps:
1. If you have not done so already, complete the General Application on DePaul Scholarship Connect:
a. Log into the DePaul Scholarship Connect using your Campus Connect ID and password.
b. Complete and submit the General Application.
i. Your General Application will be marked with a green checkmark to indicate that it has been completed and submitted successfully.
ii. If it is gray, the application was not submitted successfully; try again.
2. After submitting the General Application, you can search the scholarship by typing the name or by using any key word in the name in the search bar.
3. Click on the blue “Apply” button next to the application name. Additional questions or information may be required to complete the application process.
After Submitting an Application:
You can monitor the status of your application by logging it to your dashboard on DePaul Scholarship Connect.
For questions, please contact us at ofascholarships@depaul.edu or csd@depaul.edu. more...

Delta Sigma Pi Scholarship
Delta Sigma Pi is a professional fraternity organized to foster the study of business in universities; to encourage scholarship, social activity, and the association of students for their mutual advancement through research and practice; to promote a closer affiliation between the commercial world and students of commerce; and to further a higher standard of commercial ethics and culture and the civic and commercial welfare of the community.
CRITERIA:
Business major
Member of Delta Sigma Pi
Demonstrated outstanding contributions to the field of business on campus and/or in the community more...

Depaul Academic Scholarship Reinstatement Appeal 2022-23
If you feel that exceptional circumstances kept you from meeting the renewal requirements of your scholarship and you have a solid plan for corrective action, you may appeal for the reinstatement of your scholarship. Please use this application to explain the circumstances and submit any supporting documentation.
Please understand that submission of an appeal does not guarantee reinstatement. The Office of Financial Aid reserves the right to deny an appeal, reinstate at a reduced amount, or change the source or type of funding of the original award in the appeal process. Once your appeal is submitted, you will receive a decision within 7-10 business days.
This appeal is specifically regarding the following undergraduate scholarships:
State Scholar Plus Scholarship
Presidential Scholarship
Dean’s Scholarship
DePaul Scholars Award
St. Vincent DePaul Scholarship
Catholic Heritage Scholarship
Chicago Promise Scholarship
Vincentian Award
Global DePaul Scholarship
Transfer/Phi Theta Kappa/DAPP/Heritage Scholarships
Please note: if you are not currently meeting Satisfactory Academic Progress (SAP), your Scholarship Reinstatement Appeal cannot be processed. If that is your situation, please visit the University’s website for information on how to submit a SAP Appeal.
If you have any questions about the Scholarship Reinstatement Appeal, please email ofascholarships@depaul.edu more...

Depaul Community Service Scholarship
Scholarship for incoming freshmen attending DePaul University in Illinois full-time. Applicants must have demonstrated an exceptional record of community service. Recipients will be required to minor in Community Service Studies which comprises six additional courses, three of which are unique to the community service studies program. Students are also requried to complete at least 30 hours of community service each quarter with one of the community partners. Candidates must meet with the Program Coordinator quarterly on an individual basis as well as on a large group basis. Number of awards varies. Renewable; 4 years. more...

Depaul Freshman Scholarships
The DePaul Freshman Scholarships is available to entering freshmen at DePaul University. Priority consideration is given to students who submit their admission applications by November 15—so be sure to apply by this date. more...

Depaul Journalism Program/Center For Strategic And International Studies (Csis) Bootcamp
CSIS JOURNALISM BOOTCAMP – SUMMER 2022
The DePaul Journalism Program and the Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS), a bipartisan think tank, jointly offer a unique practicum experience through the CSIS Journalism Bootcamp in Summer 2022.
We seek 10 talented students to represent DePaul in this program, which will involve an all-expenses-paid trip to Washington, D.C. (July 16-23, 2022).
Selected students will engage in a multimedia reporting project that investigates food waste issues and solutions, thereby gaining knowledge and skills in storytelling and explanatory journalism.
During the week-long stay in D.C. students will have opportunities to interview world-renowned experts and interact with veteran journalists as well as top-level speakers on the subject matter. DePaul students will work with CSIS iDeas Lab mentors to produce a long-form story in multimedia (written text, audio, video, data visualization). The reporting project will be published on the CSIS official website and shared with its networks of experts and journalists.
Previous projects by DePaul students:
https://journalism.csis.org/is-ecocide-inevitable-in-the-worlds-most-contested-sea/
https://journalism.csis.org/thinking-outside-the-bubble-addressing-polarization-and-disinformation-on-social-media/
More details about the program:
https://journalism.csis.org/
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GNYs4ebbdgU
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZaUBKrRtc8U
For additional information or inquiries, please contact Prof. Hai Tran at htran10@depaul.edu
Qualifications
- Excellent reporting, writing and editing skills
- Excellent collaboration skills
Plus any of the following:
- Strong video skills
- Strong audio skills
- Strong data visualization skills
Applicants must provide a resume, cover letter and two journalistic work samples. Selected students must be available for the duration of the CSIS Journalism Bootcamp (July 16-23, 2022). more...

Depaul Leadership Scholarship
Scholarship for incoming freshmen attending DePaul University in Illinois full-time. Applicants must have demonstrated an exceptional record of leadership within their high school, home or religious community. Recipients are required to maintain contact with the Student Leadership Institute and/or University Ministries for mentoring and advising purposes. Number of awards varies. Renewable; 4 years. more...

Depaul Leadership Scholarship Application
YOU MUST BE AN INCOMING FRESHMAN FOR THE 2018-2019 ACADEMIC YEAR TO APPLY FOR THIS SCHOLARSHIP
The deadline for application submission online must be no later than December 1, 2017 11:59:59 PM Central Standard Time.
The DePaul Leadership Scholarship is awarded to incoming traditional freshmen students. The DePaul Leadership Scholarship Program is designed to prepare students to act as socially responsible leaders who are dedicated to Vincentian values such as compassion, promoting human dignity and a commitment to social justice. Recipients of this scholarship will engage in leadership development experiences, community service, spiritual growth and interfaith dialogues. Scholars will maintain supportive relationships with each other and with mentors in the Student Leadership Institute and University Ministry.
To be considered, you must demonstrate leadership ability, community service experience, a desire to grow spiritually and a commitment to serve the poor and marginalized and/or address societal concerns. Visit https://studentaffairs.depaul.edu/sli/scholars.html for more information.
As financial need is a consideration, we strongly encourage you to file the FAFSA, if applicable. The FAFSA can be filed as soon as possible after October 1st, 2017. For additional information on the scholarship application process, please contact the Scholarship Office in the Office of Admission at (312) 362-8704 or scholarship@depaul.edu. more...

Depaul University
DePaul awards more than $5 million in scholarships to enrolled transfer students each year, and more than $37 million in need-based gift aid on an annual basis.
By submitting an updated FAFSA to DePaul, you will be considered for additional grant funds. In recent years, new transfer students have received financial aid award packages of up to $30,000 annually. more...

The Transfer Scholarship is available to entering transfers at DePaul University. You must have attended another college and will have a 3.0 cumulative GPA in addition to completing at least 15 semester (22 quarter) hours of transferable college credit at the time of enrollment to be eligible for this award. more...

Depaul University Transfer Scholarships
Scholarship for transfer students accepted to DePaul University. Student must have a minimum 3.30 GPA in at least 30 semester or 45 quarter hours of transferable credit from an Illinois community college. April deadline is for priority consideration; final deadline is July 1st. Finalists must attend an interview during the Transfer Scholarship Interview weekend in April or July. Number of awards varies. Renewable; awards will be adjusted to reflect half-time status. more...

Digital Communication And Media Arts, Digital Communication Track Study Abroad Scholarship
The DCMA-Digital Communication track program has funding to support students who are participating in a College of Communication study abroad trip in Summer 2020.
The study abroad programs that qualify for this award are:
• France, The Netherlands, and Spain: International Advertising – Creativity & Portfolio-Building Abroad
• Spain: Cinema and The City
• Taiwan and Japan: Advertising and Branding in Asia
• United Kingdom: Harry Potter & the Fan Experience
The classes associated with each of these study abroad programs can apply as ADDITIONAL ELECTIVES in your DCMA program.
For more information about any of these programs, please visit the Study Abroad Website
Eligibility:
1. You must be a DCMA-Digital Communication track student.
2. You must be accepted into a College of Communication Summer 2020 study abroad trip. If you do not get accepted into the program, you will not be eligible to receive this scholarship.
3. You must be enrolled in at least 4 credit hours in Spring 2020.
4. DePaul University Staff members cannot combine this award with the staff tuition waiver
To apply please submit:
1. A one-page letter detailing how this study abroad experience will help you meet your academic and/or professional goals and how this experience is connected to your overall experience in the DCMA program.
2. A copy of your DePaul unofficial transcripts
3. A current resume
Deadline: February 3rd, 2020 more...

Dirk Derrick Car & Truck Accident Injury Scholarship
Auto accidents can be life changing. At The Derrick Law Firm, we believe in keeping the public safe by bringing first hand experience to those who haven’t had it, as well as easing the stress of accident victims as they enter one of the most important phases of their lives.
Eligibility
for any current or soon-to-be undergrad who has had his or her life altered due to an injury from a car or truck accident, be it their own injury, that of a loved one, or an influential individual
How to Apply
submit the online application form with an essay where you explain, present, inspire, or otherwise convince as to why you deserve to win this scholarship
Notifying Recipients
scholarship is awarded December 20, 2022
To learn more and start your application, click on the Visit button below. more...

Dnp Program Jonas Nurse Leader Scholarship
The Jonas Nurse Scholar Program’s goal is to increase the number of doctorally-prepared faculty available to teach in nursing schools nationwide, and the number of nurse leaders providing direct patient care and filling roles as clinical faculty. Sponsored by the Jonas Center for Nursing and Veterans Healthcare (Jonas Center), the program will provide financial assistance, leadership development, and networking support to expand the pipeline of future nurse faculty and advanced practice nurses.
Jonas Scholar will be required to report on scholar’s progress to date, including courses taken, and any publications or presentations; challenges and successes; and dissertations/capstone topic and progress.
The Jonas Scholar at DePaul University is made possible by a grant from the Jonas Center for Nursing and Veterans Healthcare. more...

Donna S. Phillips Scholarship
This account was established in 2004 to honor Dr. Donna Phillips, former chair of the Dept. of Physical Education at WIU, upon her retirement from WIU. Funding for this account has come primarily through solicitations of family, friends, and co-workers after Donna’s death in 2009. An annual 5k run/walk was started in 2010 to help raise funds to get the account at endowment status.
CRITERIA:
• Sophomore, Junior or Senior undergraduate student with a major in the Department of Kinesiology.
• Minimum WIU GPA of 2.75
• Student must be engaged in professional organizations or activities within their chosen field (SHAPE, IAHPERD, NATA, NSCA, ACSM, etc.) and/or professional student associations at WIU (ATSA, DES, APEK, ESSA, etc.).
TERMS:
Amount of award will be based on the earnings in the endowment. The award will be applied to the student’s account ½ in the fall and ½ in the spring semester. more...

The Downers Grove National Bank Scholarship assists high school seniors expecting to graduate who have made an exceptional effort through school or community activities. This scholarship is generously funded by Downers Grove National Bank. Applicants must be graduating from a Downers Grove high school in the applicable academic year, be a resident of District 502 (College of DuPage’s district), be registered for at least 12 credit hours, have a GPA of 3.0 or higher, and provide evidence of exceptional effort or achievement through school- or community-related activities. Doyle Endowed Scholarship Application
DEADLINE EXTENDED TO JULY 27, 2022
The Doyle Scholarship will be awarded for the 2022-2023 Academic Year.
Consideration for this scholarship shall be given to full-time rising junior and senior students at DePaul who have financial need, who have a minimum GPA of 2.5, who have been involved at DePaul and their greater community, and have leadership and service experience serving marginalized communities.
APPLICANTS MUST MEET ALL OF THE FOLLOWING CRITERIA
Demonstrate a commitment to service and student involvement
Demonstrate leadership skills
Be active in the community
Possess a cumulative GPA of 2.5 or above

Demonstrate financial need by having a Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) on file with the Office of Financial Aid (DePaul)
Be a full-time undergraduate student at DePaul University
ADDITIONAL INFORMATION
By completing the application for this scholarship you are authorizing the Office of Multicultural Student Success and the Scholarship Committee to review your financial and academic records in order to assess your application.
Please direct ALL QUESTIONS regarding this scholarship to:
Darryl Arrington
Office of Multicultural Student Success
PHONE: (312) 362-7278
EMAIL: DARRINGT@depaul.edu more...

Dr. David Deboeuf Memorial Scholarship
HISTORY:
Dr. DeBoeuf was a Finance professor at WIU from 1995 until his passing in 2020. With expertise in the areas of corporate finance and multinational corporate management, he was known as a professor who truly cared about the well-being of his students. He went above and beyond to ensure their success in understanding difficult material as well as instilling confidence in their abilities. His kind nature and sense of humor was appreciated by both students and colleagues alike. He served as the advisor to the Investment Group from 1999 to 2011, which was then converted to back to back semesters of stock investing courses focused on managing actual WIU Foundation money. Dr. DeBoeuf received his doctorate from Louisiana State University after successful careers with Allstate Insurance and General Binding Corporation.
Upon his sudden passing, his siblings, Mike and Jim DeBoeuf and Patty Krisman, gave generously to begin this scholarship in their brother’s memory. Having a deep understanding of their brother’s passion for teaching and generous nature to those less fortunate than himself, it was their hope that this scholarship would honor his devotion to students and his love of WIU.
CRITERIA:
Senior Finance Major or MBA student with concentration in Finance in year scholarship is received
3.5 Minimum GPA
Highest level of financial need should be a determining factor
After above criteria have been met, preference should be given to those with campus and community involvement more...

Dr. Dominic G. & Helen T. Parisi Scholarship In The Department Of Management
Awarded to deserving undergraduate students enrolled in Driehaus College of Business within the Department of Management. Applicants must submit an essay stating their areas of interests in Management. Only undergraduate students who are Management majors will be considered.
If you have additional questions regarding this scholarship or this scholarship application process, please contact the Department of Management. more...

Dr. George E. Ayers Scholarship
The Ayers Family Established this memorial scholarship for Dr. George E. Ayers who earned a B.S. degree from WIU in 1961. Dr. Ayers spent more than 50 years in higher education as a university administrator and then as a consultant. He was always concerned with the access to higher education for under served groups and successful completion of degree programs.
Criteria:
US. Citizenship
Minority
GPA 3.0
Financial Need
Any class
Rank by highest GPA more...

Dr. James D. Price Delta Chi Business Education Scholarship
For Career and Technical Education (Business Emphasis) majors in Delta Chi Fraternity or Phi Beta Lambda. Requires 3.0 GPA. Renewable.
Full description:
The following criteria must be met:
The recipient(s) must be a full-time student, majoring in Career and Technical Education with an emphasis in Business Education, accepted to Eastern Illinois University.
The recipient(s) must be a member in good standing with the EIU Delta Chi Fraternity.
The recipient(s) must have an overall GPA of 3.0.
Financial need may be a consideration but is not a requirement.
If no Delta Chi member qualifies, the criteria may be expanded to include qualifying Phi Beta Lambda members in good standing.
The recipient(s) may be eligible to apply for the award again provided he/she continues to meet criteria.
This award shall be announced in the Spring and disbursed in the Fall semester. more...

Dr. Marion Blackinton Kinesiology Scholarship
HISTORY:
The Western Illinois University Foundation will hereby establish a scholarship endowment per the terms of this agreement, to become effective on such date as the minimum funding requirements for an endowed scholarship fund have been received and accepted by the Foundation. This scholarship endowment fund has been established by Dr. Marion Blackinton to provide financial assistance to a sophomore, junior, or senior WIU student majoring in one of the degree programs offered in the Department of Kinesiology. Blackinton, a 1990 inductee into the Western Illinois Athletics Hall of Fame, was instrumental in the founding of the Gateway Athletic Conference and in the continuing development of the women’s athletic program. During her tenure, Western moved from the AIAW ranks to its NCAA Division I status. She served as a coach, administrator, instructor and women’s athletics director for 19 years.
CRITERIA:
 Applicant must be a sophomore, junior, or senior WIU student majoring in one of the degree programs offered in the Department of Kinesiology.
 A GPA of 3.0 or better.  Demonstrates financial need using the FAFSA or other information.  Preference given to a WIU female student athlete.  Activity/involvement within the Department of Kinesiology and/or the community.
TERMS:
The award amount is determined by the annual interest rate on the endowment. The award will be applied to the student’s university account ½ fall and ½ spring.
In any year in which there are no qualified applicants, income may be accumulated or reinvested in the endowment at the discretion of the administrator of the fund.
SELECTION PROCESS: Recipient will be selected by the Department of Kinesiology Scholarship Selection Committee. more...

Dr. Maureen N. Dunne Autism Student Success Scholarship

1. Maintain the academic standards set by the program
2. Enrolled in a nursing related field of study-Basic Nurse Assistant (CNA), Practical Nurse (LPN), and/or Associate Degree Nursing (ADN)
3. Enrolled in the minimum cred hours: Associate Degree Nursing (RN)-10 credit hours or Nursing full-time equivalent; Practical Nurse (LPN)-12 credit hours or LPN full-time equivalent; Basic Nurse Assistant (CNA)-6.5 credit hours or Basic Nurse Assistant full-time equivalent
4. If enrolled in Associate Degree in Nursing-student must be accepted into LLCC’s Associate Degree in Nursing Program more...

Dr. Russell R. Dohner Scholarship
Dr. Dohner graduated from Vermont High School in 1943. His father had hoped he would take up farming, but Russell knew since he was a young boy, inspired by the town doctor who’d treated him as a child, that he wanted to be doctor. In 1946, Dr. Dohner became one of the first four pre-med students at then-Western Illinois Teacher’s College, now Western Illinois University and was the first doctor produced by WIU.
CRITERIA:
Incoming freshman
Minimum 20 ACT

Enrolled full-time
U.S. citizen
Plan to major in pre-med or other medical field
First preference to a student from Rushville, IL, then to a student from Schuyler County, IL, then to student sfrom counties surrounding Schuyler County, then to Illinois residents
Financial need using the FAFSA may be considered
Year 1 = $1,000/year
Year 2 = $1,000/year
Year 3 = $2,000/year
Year 4 = $3,000/year
This scholarship is renewable up to three years if the student maintains a minimum 3.0 GPA and continues in a medical-related major. more...

Dr. Summit Shah Md Scholarship
Dr. Summit Shah has founded the Dr. Summit Shah MD Scholarship in reaction to the rising tuition costs. Dr. Summit Shah graduated as valedictorian from Bishop Watterson High School before attending Ohio State University, where he earned a Bachelor’s with Honors. He stayed at OSU and earned his MD from the College of Medicine at Ohio State. He has been a tireless advocate of access to higher education and has founded the Summit Shah Scholarship to ensure that deserving students from all parts of the economic spectrum can reach their academic goals.
It’s a terrific opportunity for your students, I’ll list the details below:
Eligibility:
Eligibility parameters are as follows:
• High school students graduating this calendar year and have been accepted into a college, university, trade school, or design school are eligible to apply
• Students currently enrolled in a college, university, trade school, or design school.
• All majors and areas of studies are encouraged to apply
Essay Question:
Life is hard and it takes motivation to be persistence to reach your goals. To be considered for this scholarship, please submit a short essay (500 words or less) that shares what some of the professional goals that you hope to achieve in the next five years are with Dr. Summit Shah.
Submission Deadline:
July 1, 2021
Winner Selection:
One winner will be selected in early August 2020. The winner will be contacted after selection. If the winner does not respond, a new winner will be selected. more...

Dr. Toby And Stuart Glicken Memorial Endowed Scholarship
SCPS – Awarded to deserving undergraduate students enrolled in the School of Continuing and Professional Studies with demonstrated financial need and a minimum 3.0 GPA. Preference shall be given to an applicant who is currently taking science classes.
Please Note: You MUST be enrolled in six credit hours during the quarter in order to meet the eligibility requirements for the scholarship.
This scholarship requires you to upload a copy of your unofficial transcript. If you have not already done so, please go back to the Conditional Application to upload.
**If you are awarded a scholarship, you will receive notification on your Financial Aid Award. You will also be notified via the Scholarship Connect.
For additional information about the scholarship application process, please visit http://www.snl.depaul.edu/StudentResources/Scholarships/index.asp

The following criteria must be met:
1. The recipient(s) must be a full-time student at Eastern Illinois University.
2. The recipient(s) must be a declared major in Psychology.
3. The recipient(s) must be a Junior, Senior, or graduate student at the time of award.
4. The recipient(s) must work closely with Psychology faculty on research projects
5. Preference shall be given to the student(s) who is likely to publish an article or present a paper at a professional meeting in collaboration with Psychology faculty.

Drug Lawsuit Source College Scholarship
Our staff at Drug Lawsuit Source is deeply committed to helping those who have a strong desire to be successful. We understand the rising cost of higher education has become increasingly more difficult to manage, and student loan debt is at an all-time high. The Drug Lawsuit Source College Scholarship is a single $1,000 scholarship offered to students who are currently attending or will be attending an accredited college, university or trade school in 2022.
Eligibility
Student must be enrolled in any high school or accredited junior college, college, university, or trade school for the 2022 summer or fall semester of classes.
NOTE: High school seniors are eligible to apply if they will be attending any post-secondary school in the summer or fall semesters.
How To Apply
To apply for the scholarship, you must do the following:
1. Provide your full legal name, current address, phone number, e-mail address, and name of the institution you are currently attending or will be attending in 2021.
2. Type a 500-750 word essay, either as a Microsoft Word attachment or directly in the body of the e-mail, describing your educational career and goals. Explain how you plan to achieve these goals and any adversity that you may face on your journey to success. Please include your degree or major, why you chose to pursue it, and how it will help you to achieve your ultimate goals.
Deadline
November 1, 2022
To learn more and start your application, click on the Visit button below. more...

Drug Lawsuit Source Single Parent Scholarship
To help single parents reach their educational goals, Drug Lawsuit Source is offering one (1) single parent scholarship in the amount of $1,000. The scholarship will be awarded to a single mother or father.
Eligibility
You must be a single parent helping to raise at least one child. You do not have to have full-time custody, but must be involved in raising the child.
You must be currently enrolled in a U.S. high school, trade school, apprentice school, junior college, college, university, or graduate school in the United States.
You must have a GPA of 2.7 or higher and are required to submit a copy of your transcript indicating your grade point average (GPA). You may submit an unofficial school transcript.
How To Apply
Apply by e-mail only at scholarships@druglawsuitsource.com
In the e-mail subject line, type “Single Parent Scholarship Application“
To apply for the Drug Lawsuit Source Single Parent Scholarship, you must do the following:
Provide your full legal name, current address, phone number, e-mail address, and name of your current school.
Provide us with the first name only and the age of each child that you are helping to raise.
Type a 300-600 word essay in the e-mail explaining your career goals and the challenges of being a single parent in school.
Attach an official or unofficial school transcript for your current school.
Provide the name, address, phone number, and e-mail of an academic reference, such as a teacher or counselor at your current school.
By submitting an application, you are verifying that you are a single parent enrolled in school and give us permission to put your name on our website if you are awarded a scholarship. You are also giving Drug Lawsuit Source permission to review your academic record. We will not share your personal information with anyone and will destroy your transcript and personal essay after the scholarships are awarded to protect your privacy.
Scholarship Deadline
- November 1, 2022.
Award Amount
-$1000.00
To learn more and start your application, click on the Visit button below. more...

Dupage County Farm Bureau Foundation
The DuPage County Farm Bureau Foundation was established by the DuPage County Farm Bureau to carry the Heritage of DuPage County Agriculture into the future. Within the families of this greater community of people, lie the promises of tomorrow’s agricultural industry and those who will make today’s dreams the realities of tomorrow.
As a not-for-profit entity, the DuPage County Farm Bureau Foundation solicits and distributes private funding for agriculturally-related education and leadership training, Ag-In-The-Classroom programs, public library collection development, charitable activities and research.
Our Board of Trustees is compromised of members of the DuPage County Farm Bureau Board of Directors and the General Manager, who serves as Executive Director. more...

Eagle Touch Scholarship
Technology – Students Scholarship Program
This educational scholarship fund aims to give back to society and to help students in need to pursue their dreams, so we are offering USD 3000 scholarship to any college students who are interested in science and technology, and who have the enthusiasm and specific ideas especially in the area of Touch Display Technology.
SUBMISSION REQUIREMENTS:
Applicants must be currently enrolled in High School, University or College as a full-time student (2019-2020 school year).
There will be three contest submission dates. To be eligible for the contest submit your essay by one the submission dates.
1st Term: May 15 – September 1
2nd Term: September 1- December 14
Winners announced 03/12/21
1) Please attach your photo along with your Essay
2) Attach scanned copies of documents that prove your identity.
3) Attach the documents confirming your enrollment in college or institute
Recommendations for writing an Essay:
1) It is necessary to answer a number of questions:
-What is a Touch Screen?
-Where is the Touch Screen used?
-Types of touch screens
-The advantages of using touch-screens
-What types of businesses could use screen monitors?
2) Your Essay must be at least 2000 words.
3) Use photos and images
4) Use headings and subheadings
More information on the program can be found at
https://www.eagle-touch.com/scholarship/ more...

Egan Schools Project Assistants - Service Scholars
Must be an Undergraduate student
Must be available during the school day hours 8 am- 5:30 pm twice a week
Mandatory professional development once a month
*About The Egan Office:
The Egan Office believes that schools are important community institutions that can contribute to and benefit from an asset-based approach to community building and development. The Egan school partnership program is a community service work-study program that allows DePaul University students to serve in Chicago’s most under-resourced schools providing classroom assistance, tutoring, mentoring, and supplemental enrichment activities. In the tradition of Monsignor Egan, Egan student employees also learn about issues that impact communities and engage directly in action research, planning and programming aimed at addressing critical urban problems, alleviating poverty, and promoting social justice.
POSITION SUMMARY:
EPAs support the School Community Organizer (SCO) in the planning, development, and implementation of three school projects per year, one per quarter. These projects are led by the SCO and supported by the EPAs. The projects are a team contribution to the school, families, and/or community.
Egan Project Assistants (EPAs) contribute to the planning, development and implementation of special enrichment activities such as science fairs, debate club, chess club, soccer teams, Spanish language instruction, dance classes, or other activities. EPAs must have excellent attendance, a willingness to travel to schools and other sites by public transportation, and must commit to work in their assigned school for at least one academic year (three DePaul quarters excluding summer term).*
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Support the School Community Organizer (SCO) in the planning, development, and implementation of three school projects per year, one per quarter. These projects are led by the SCO and supported by the EPAs. The projects are a team contribution to the school, families, and/or community.
Ensure excellent in-person school assistance such as after-school, recess support, mentoring, family engagement, or tutoring (only if interested and approved by the principal).
Provide between 10 -12 hours per week in school service. Complete a maximum of 12 hours a week combined with team meetings and professional development during 8 to 9 weeks of the fall, winter and spring terms. No summer.
Attend and actively participate in mandatory monthly in-person, two hour professional development. Ensure the schedule does not conflict with these events.
Participate in mandatory, regular meetings with the School Community Organizer and team and maintain strong communication.
Participate in an Egan Office committee for a commitment of 1 hour a week on average.
Adhere to all policies and procedures as determined by DePaul University, The Egan Office and the Steans Center, and the assigned school(s).Complete all onboarding and compliance documents from Egan and Steans Center within 30 days.
Maintain confidentiality and adhere to mandated policies and procedures regarding child neglect and abuse.
Share my gifts and talents with the Egan Office.
Other duties as assigned.
POSITION REQUIREMENTS:
*As an Egan Office Service Scholar you must:
Be willing to commit to 10-12 hours per week for the entire school year (fall, winter, spring) including work at your assigned school, team meeting, professional development and training.
Be eligible for federal financial aid, or DACA. * DACAmented students are eligible and encouraged to apply!

Be a full- or part-time DePaul University student, 18 years or older.
Be willing to provide your own transportation or use public transportation to your assigned school (off campus).
Complete a TB test.
Complete child protection/child abuse reporting training and criminal background checks.
Be flexible in working with young students in public schools with limited resources.
Have a positive enthusiastic attitude as a role model for young children and youth.
Be open to learning new perspectives about education, community-building and social justice.
Be able and willing to work with and learn from people of diverse backgrounds.
Be able to work well both independently and as a team member.
Be punctual with an excellent attendance record.
Have strong organizational skills as well as written, oral and interpersonal communication skills.
Previous experience with children and youth preferred.
Bilingual is a plus but is not required* more...

Eileen And Reuben Seltzer Scholarship For Adult Learners
For General Studies majors (full- or part-time). Requires 2.0 GPA, 6 hours in BGS, essay; preferably from Chicago, surrounding IL counties.
Full description:
The following criteria must be met:
The recipient(s) must be at least a part-time student majoring in the Bachelor of General Studies Program (BGS) and accepted to
Eastern Illinois University.
At the time of the award, the recipient(s) shall have completed at least 6 hours in the Bachelor of General Studies Program.
Recipient(s) must maintain a GPA of at least 2.0.
Financial need is not a consideration.
Preference shall be given to applicants whose residence is Chicago or the surrounding area. The surrounding area includes the following counties: Cook, DuPage, Lake, McHenry, or Will Counties in Illinois.
The recipient(s) may be eligible to receive the award again provided he/she continues to meet criteria.
This award shall be announced in the Fall and disbursed in the Spring semester.
Keywords: interdisciplinary studies, IDS, general studies, BGS, liberal arts, multidisciplinary, online, non-traditional, nontraditional, adult, adult learning, adult learner, degree completion, adult Elder Abuse And Neglect Article Scholarship
Elder Abuse and Neglect is an ever growing problem facing our society today. By informing the public on the signs and symptoms we can help bring a stop to this dreadful act. Articles are a terrific way to display information about elder abuse and neglect as they are interesting and easily shareable. At the Peck Law Group we are constantly moving towards the goal of eliminating elder neglect and abuse in California and throughout the United States.
Eligibility
Anyone that has been accepted to a college or trade school.
Students enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate degree program in the United States.
How To Apply
Create an article on elder abuse and neglect in assisted living facilities of at least 1000 words (the more content the better, be creative!). Below are some facts to get started, however we recommend browsing our website / the internet for more.
Simply send us an email with your original elder abuse and neglect article to thepecklawgroup@gmail.com and include the following information:
Full name, address, and phone number.
Name of college or trade school planning to attend / currently attending.
If under 18, please provide us with the legal guardians contact information.
Notifying the Recipient
Winner will be notified via email by January 29, 2023
To learn more and start your application, click on the Visit button below. more...

Elizabeth & Robert Webb Endowed Scholarship
Due to a generous gift from Mr. Robb Webb, the Elizabeth & Robb Webb Endowed Scholarship was created for students enrolled as majors or minors in the School of Hospitality Leadership. All *undergraduate*students enrolled as majors or minors in the School of Hospitality Leadership are eligible, and are encouraged to apply for the scholarship funding. Applicants must be in good academic standing and exhibit financial need (as determined by the FAFSA).
In addition to financial need, included in the review process is also consideration for cumulative GPA (2.0 or higher), student activity such as belonging to hospitality clubs or holding club leadership positions, and having full or part time jobs in the hospitality industry.
SCHOLARSHIP APPLICATION DEADLINE: Sunday, SEPTEMBER 18th, 2022
Please note, in order to be considered for the Elizabeth & Robb Webb Endowed Scholarship, you must complete all required fields of the online application. Applications must be completed and submitted online by 11:59:59 PM on Sunday, September 18th , 2022 Incomplete or late applications will not be considered. more...

Elizabeth Glenadine Gibb Math Scholarship
The Elizabeth Glenadine Gibb Mathematics Scholarship was established by a gift from the estate of the late Elizabeth Glenadine Gibb. CRITERIA: Incoming freshman, Exemplify those personal traits which demonstrate potential for successful teaching (The high school senior who is applying must have two letters of recommendation in support of these qualities. One should be from a teacher of mathematics at their high school and one from the principal or counselor of the high school), The applicant must meet one of the following: Have an ACT composite score of at least 27 or equivalent; Be in the upper ten percent of the high school class and have an ACT composite score of at least 22. Have a 3.2 or above grade point average for all coursework at an accredited college or university.
Have the teaching of mathematics as a career goal (In applying for the scholarship students will be asked to describe their goals including the personal reason(s) they see the teaching of mathematics as a career choice.) more...

Ellen Benjamin Nonprofit Leadership Endowed Scholarship - Graduate
SCPS – For consideration, you must be enrolled in the School of Continuing and Professional Studies, be in good academic standing, exhibit financial need (by submitting the FAFSA), and profess interest in professional and volunteer non-profit management, activism or philanthropy.
You MUST be enrolled in at least four credit hours during the quarter in order to meet the eligibility requirements for the scholarship.
This scholarship requires you to upload a copy of your unofficial transcript. If you have not already done so, please go back to the Conditional Application to upload.

This scholarship honors the memory of Ellen Johnson, an Anthropology professor at College of DuPage, a lifelong learner, and educator, and is funded by family and friends of Ellen Johnson. Emergency Needs Fund Scholarship
Only currently enrolled students may apply. This assistance is designed to help students continue their education at Waubonsee Community College that directly impacts their classes.
The emergency must be a “one-time, new barrier or obstacle” that is “unexpected or unusual”:
Provide clear, supporting documents of the circumstance
Submit a clear statement on how this impacts their ability to attend classes for the semester
Have completed 6 credits at Waubonsee Community College
Are enrolled in a minimum of 6 credit hours
Have demonstrated potential for academic success
Academically in good standing
Do not have student conduct cases that put them in a negative standing at the College
Funding is provided through donations, amounts are limited and not all requests are approved. The maximum amount awarded is $1,000 with the average amount awarded between $200 to $500.
If you have any questions or need assistance, contact emergencyneeds@waubonsee.edu.
Logging in for the first time:
Current Waubonsee students:
Click on the “Sign Up” button above.
Enter your Waubonsee student email address and create a password.
Once you create a password, you will receive an email with a link to click on to confirm your identity.
New students:
First, submit a New Student Application (NSA): waubonsee.edu/nsif. After your form has been processed, you will be assigned a Waubonsee student ID number (x-number) and may begin the scholarship account activation process.
Click on the “Sign Up” button above.
Enter the email address you used to complete the NSA and create a password.
Note: Once you have registered and been assigned a Waubonsee student email, this will become your default username.
Once you create a password, you will receive an email with a link to click on to confirm your identity. more...
