Mickey R. Price Accounting Scholarship
Mickey R. Price earned a Bachelor of Business in Accountancy and Information Systems from Western Illinois University in 1975. While a student, he received a full tuition talent grant through the School of Music and was also a member of Theta Chi fraternity. Understanding how scholarships helped him attain his own degree, he chose to give back to help future students. Mickey earned an Executive MBA from the Owen School of Management at Vanderbilt University in 1990. Mickey has served as a Church Administrator, and now the Chief Financial Officer, at the Paradise Valley United Methodist Church in Arizona since 2002. Prior to this role, he served as the Corporate Controller for Chickasha Cotton Oil Company and a Division Controller for multiple manufacturing plants for Dean Foods.
Mickey is also active in community work as he co-founded Forever Young Musical Enterprises Inc., a non-profit organization preserving and performing Big Band jazz and swing music. He also serves in various leadership capacities and board roles within the United Methodist Church, the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants, The Church Network, and the Scottsdale Training and Rehabilitation Services, a nonprofit organization providing care for individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities.
Mickey is married to Betty Brunlieb Price and is the proud father of two wonderful adult children. He remains active in the Percussive Arts Society-Arizona Chapter, where he also established a student scholarship program.
CRITERIA:
Accountancy Major
Sophomore standing or above
US Citizen
No minimum GPA requirement
Preference given to members of Theta Chi fraternity.
Service to others and involvement in campus activities may be used as final determining factor. more...

Applicants must have a minimum ACT score of 23 and graduated in the top 25%. Due date and number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

The MidAmerica National Bank Scholarship is available to freshmen and transfer students at Western Illinois University. Freshmen students must be a resident of Fulton, Mcdonough, Peoria, or Rock Island counties; have a minimum 25 ACT score and rank in the top 20 percent of their graduating class. Transfer students must be transferring from Black Hawk or Spoon River Colleges and have a minimum 3.5 GPA to be eligible for this award. more...

Modern Language Graduate Education Award
This award will service graduate students within the Department of Modern Languages. The award will support students attending a professional conference, completing project research for a capstone course, or studying abroad in pursuit of their educational endeavors. The applicant must have completed 24 quarter credit hours towards their MA, be in good academic standing within the program, and submit a completed proposal via the DePaul online scholarship application website.
The MOL Graduate Education Award will be given via reimbursement for travel expenses. However, if there are extenuating or financial circumstances that prevent a reimbursement, other arrangements can be made. The department will provide further explanation of the process upon selection.
Please view/download Modern Languages MA Award guidelines for proposal and budget narrative guidelines. Any omitted information that is required by the guidelines may be grounds for disqualification.
Selection Process:
A committee of three faculty from the Department of Modern Languages will review all proposals, applying the criteria listed below, and recommend awards by 15 February.
Is the proposal clear and coherent, avoiding jargon and unexplained references?
Does it explain persuasively that the contribution of the proposed use to the applicant’s success in the MA program?
Does it describe clear and appropriate outcomes that are expected, as well as a reasonable timetable?
Is the proposed budget clear, complete, well explained and well documented? more...

Modern Languages Award
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Millikin University enrolled in the Modern Languages Department. Applicants must show excellence in linguistics or outstanding work in literary criticism. Due date and award amount may vary. more...

Molly Jean Hartman Memorial Endowed Award
Awarded to School of Public Service graduate students studying abroad in to Northern Ireland. Academic merit and financial need will be considered. This award is NOT renewable or transferable to a different Study Abroad program, and applicants must reapply every application period in order to be considered for the scholarship.
In order to be considered for this scholarship, please be sure to upload your unofficial transcript reflecting your latest grades in your general application.
Please note: Some of our awards cannot be used in conjunction with any other tuition-restricted university discounts, scholarships, assistantships, waivers or grants. Please refer to the scholarship application for which you are applying for further detail or contact the School of Public Service for clarification (pubserv@depaul.edu) more...

Monsignor Egan Hope Scholarships
Scholarship for students who, reside or have resided in one of Chicagos financially depressed neighborhoods, and have been accepted to DePaul University as full-time freshmen. Student must rank in the top 50% of their graduating class, possess a strong motivation to succeed, and be committed to community service and assisting youth. Finalists must attend an interview in April. Award will meet the full need of the student by filling the gap after federal and state funds are utilized. The award may be applied toward tuition and room & board, will vary depending on the students need, and is renewable up to $40,000 over 4 years. Number of awards varies. more...

Montgomery County Farm Bureau Foundation Scholarship
1. Field of study must be in an agricultural related field or a field that supports agriculture.
2. Applicant, parent or guardian must be a member of Montgomery County Farm Bureau at least 1 year before the date of March 3, 2021 and in good standing.
3. Director of Montgomery County Farm Bureau Foundation and their immediate families are ineligible to apply.
4. Applicant may not win more than tow scholarships from the Montgomery County Farm Bureau Foundation, throughout their college education.
5. Applicant will graduate this spring from high school or previously graduated from high school/GED and will be attending college during the 2021-2022 academic year.
6. Applicant must have necessary grades that qualify for college entrance or acceptance, or a qualified trade school such as agriculture.
7. Applicant will take designated hours to qualify as a full-time student.
8. Applicant must exemplify good citizenship.
9. The scholarship committee will make any and all selections. Judges will be selected at random.
10. Three, $2,000 scholarships will be awarded to high school seniors. Three, $2,000 scholarships will be awarded to those already attending college, provided there are sufficient applicants that qualify in each class.
11. An alternate will be selected if any of the scholarship recipients cannot or choose not to attend college. The alternate will receive the scholarship if eligible. All scholarship money will be repaid to the Montgomery County Foundation if student drops out of school before completing the semester in which the money was awarded.
12. The scholarship award will be sent directly to the Financial Department of your chosen college or trade school.
13. If any or all of the scholarship funding is not used, it may be carried over to the next semester. Otherwise, the balance will be returned to the Montgomery County Farm Bureau Foundation.
14. Recipients will be notified by April 30, 2021. more...

Morgan Fitch Scholarship
Scholarship for Illinois residents who are undergraduate or graduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Illinois-Champaign, Urbana College of Commerce and Business Administration or College of Liberal Arts and Sciences. Students must have a 3.5 GPA on a 5.0 GPA scale, be U.S. citizens, completed 60 college credit hours, and be pursuing a real estate career. An interview is required. Number of awards may vary. A personal statement must be included with application packet. more...

Morris Bart, Llc Anti-Distracted Driving Scholarship
The Morris Bart, LLC Anti-Distracted Driving Scholarship awards a $2,500 scholarship to one deserving college student who creates the best public service announcement (PSA) video that outlines the dangers of driving while distracted.
The application deadline for this scholarship is June 15, 2021.
About the Morris Bart, LLC Anti-Distracted Driving Scholarship
As part of our goal to help students thrive as they move to college and reduce the number of injuries and deaths resulting from distracted driving, Morris Bart, LLC created the Anti-Distracted Driving Scholarship of $2,500.
According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), distracted driving in the United States results in nine deaths and more than 1,000 injuries every day. The winning applicant will submit a video of 90 seconds or less that helps encourage drivers to stay focused on the road.
Eligibility Requirements for the Morris Bart, LLC Anti-Distracted Driving Scholarship
To be considered for this $2,500 scholarship, all applicants must satisfy the following requirements:
Submit documentation of a 3.0 or higher grade point average (GPA)
Must be currently enrolled in college courses at an accredited college or university or admitted to an accredited college or university for the Fall 2020 semester
Submit a 90-second or shorter video about the dangers of distracted driving, as outlined in the subsequent section
Apply using the scholarship application form on this page
Agree to the Morris Bart, LLC scholarship Terms and Conditions
Anti-Distracted Driving PSA Video Prompt
Texting while driving is just one of the dangerous activities that can lead to a serious car accident. Eating, listening to music, talking with friends, and even applying make-up can result in deadly car crashes. As part of your application for this $2,500 scholarship, please create a video PSA that warns of the dangers of distracted driving.
The best videos will be engaging, informative, and will incentivize your peers to avoid driving while distracted. Please limit the video to 90 seconds.
Apply to the Morris Bart, LLC 2020 College Scholarship Now
To apply for this scholarship, please read the terms and conditions, then fill out the application on this page. Please note that applications submitted outside of this form will not be considered.
The scholarship is open to all college students. The application deadline is June 15, 2021.
*Terms and Conditions *
Applicants for the Morris Bart, LLC Anti-Distracted Driving Scholarship must be enrolled or accepted to an accredited university or college with plans to attend in the Spring 2021 semester. Both undergraduate and graduate students may apply.
To be considered, applicants must fill out the application on the scholarship page by June 15, 2021. Applications submitted after the due date or via email, mail, social media, or any other format other than the application page will not be eligible.
Morris Bart, LLC Scholarship Committee
All applications will be reviewed by the Morris Bart, LLC scholarship committee. Please note that the scholarship committee cannot be held responsible for technical difficulties that prevent applicants from submitting their video or application before the due date.
The scholarship committee reserves the right to request additional information or supporting documentation from applicants. Failure to provide the requested documentation or updated information may disqualify the applicant.
All applications will be considered on an equal basis based on the criteria listed on the scholarship page. Factors such as age, race, gender identity, sexual preference, and other protected classes will not impact the scholarship committee’s decision.
The scholarship committee’s decision will be final and no appeals will be considered.
Scholarship Application Privacy Statement
Information submitted to Morris Bart, LLC via the scholarship application will be used solely for considering the applicant’s qualification for the scholarship.
Morris Bart, LLC will not sell, rent, or otherwise distribute personal or contact information submitted for the purpose of applying to the scholarship to any third party for any reason.
Announcement of Morris Bart, LLC Scholarship Winner
Morris Bart, LLC reserves the right to share the winner’s name and their video, either in full or in part, on the Morris Bart, LLC website, social media channels, or other outlets via press release. more...

Naperville Rotary Charities & The Rotary Club Of Naperville
Naperville Rotary Charities & the Rotary Club of Naperville assist students who are in need of financial aid to pursue an education in vocational, technical and academic courses eventually leading to a 2- or 4-year degree, and is generously funded by the Naperville Rotary House of Dreams Charity Raffle. Applicants must be residents of District 502 (College of DuPage’s district), be enrolled in at least 6 credit hours for the applicable semester, and have a cumulative GPA or better of 2.0 or higher. Applicants cannot be a Rotarian or a child or grandchild of a Rotarian, and applicants with possessing a previous degree are not eligible. Applicants must include a one-page type-written essay that includes information they believe the Scholarship Committee should know. Information may include but is not limited to: future education goals, academic achievements, leadership opportunities, community, and school participation/volunteerism and extenuating financial obligations. Award: Variable more...

Applicant must include 2 letters of recommendation. Applicants are responsible for communicating with their recommenders to ensure all materials are submitted prior to the application deadline. North American Van Lines 2022 Logistics Scholarship
North American Van Lines, one of the leading moving companies in the United States, is committed to supporting the community as well as the growth and development of the moving services and logistics industries. We believe education is the best way to ensure our industry has qualified professionals for years to come.
Because of this belief, we are proud to announce our first annual Logistics Scholarship contest. Five lucky qualified entrants will each win a $1,000 scholarship towards their degree in logistics or supply chain management at the college or university of their choice.
Eligibility
◦U.S. Citizen (or permanent resident).
◦Enrolled (or enrolling) as a full time student of an accredited college/university within the United States for completion of an undergraduate degree in Logistics or equivalent field.
◦Employees, professional affiliates, and agents of North American Van Lines (and their immediate families) are not eligible.
◦The applicant must comply with IRS rules to qualify for the tax-free benefits of the scholarship, including following.
-It does not exceed your expenses;
-It is not designated or earmarked for other purposes (such as room and board), and does not require (by its terms) that it cannot be used for qualified education expense;
-It does not represent payment for teaching, research, or other services required as a condition for receiving the scholarship.
◦You must be a Candidate for a Degree.
-Attend a primary or secondary school or are pursuing a degree at a college or university, or
-Attend an educational institution that:
-Provides a program that is acceptable for full credit toward a bachelor’s or higher degree, or offers a program of training to prepare students for gainful employment in a recognized occupation; and
-Is authorized under federal or state law to provide such a program and is accredited by a nationally recognized accreditation agency
.-Eligible educational institution. An eligible educational institution is one whose primary function is the presentation of formal instruction and that normally maintains a regular faculty and curriculum and normally has a regularly enrolled body of students in attendance at the place where it carries on its educational activities.
-Qualified education expenses. For purposes of tax-free scholarships and fellowship grants, these are expenses for:
-Tuition and fees required to enroll at or attend an eligible educational institution; and
-Course-related expenses, such as fees, books, supplies, and equipment that are required for the courses at the eligible educational institution. These items must be required of all students in your course of instruction.
-Qualified education expenses do not include the cost of:
-Room and board, Travel, Research, Clerical help, or Equipment and other expenses that are not required for enrollment in or attendance at an eligible educational institution.
How to Apply
Your Essay: Submit a brief essay of between 400 and 800 words, detailing why a career in logistics/supply chain management is your college major of choice.
To learn more and start your application, click on the Visit button below. more...

North American Van Lines Scholarship Competition
North American Van Lines, of the leading long-distance moving companies in the United States, is committed to supporting the community as well as the growth and development of the moving services and cross-country moving industries. We believe education is the best way to ensure our industry has qualified professionals for years to come. Because of the this belief, we are proud to announce our first annual Logistics Scholarship contest. Three lucky qualified entrants will each win a $1000.00 scholarship towards their degree in logistics or supply chain management at the college or university of their choice. Interested? Here’s what you need to know.
Eligibility
-U.S. Citizen (or permanent resident).
-Enrolled (or enrolling) as a full time student of an accredited college/university within the United States for completion of an undergraduate degree in Logistics or equivalent field.
-Limit of one (1) entry per contestant.
-Employees, professional affiliates, and agents of North American Van Lines (and their immediate families) are not eligible.
-The applicant must comply with IRS rules to qualify for the tax-free benefits of the scholarship, including following.
-It does not exceed your expenses;
-It is not designated or earmarked for other purposes (such as room and board), and does not require (by its terms) that it cannot be used for qualified education expense; and
-It does not represent payment for teaching, research, or other services required as a condition for receiving the scholarship.
-You must be a Candidate for a Degree. You are a Candidate for a Degree if you:
-Attend a primary or secondary school or are pursuing a degree at a college or university, or
-Attend an educational institution that:
-Provides a program that is acceptable for full credit toward a bachelor’s or higher degree, or offers a program of training to prepare students for gainful employment in a recognized occupation; and
-Is authorized under federal or state law to provide such a program and is accredited by a nationally recognized accreditation agency
-Eligible educational institution. An eligible educational institution is one whose primary function is the presentation of formal instruction and that normally maintains a regular faculty and curriculum and normally has a regularly enrolled body of students in attendance at the place where it carries on its educational activities.
-Qualified education expenses. For purposes of tax-free scholarships and fellowship grants, these are expenses for:
-Tuition and fees required to enroll at or attend an eligible educational institution; and
-Course-related expenses, such as fees, books, supplies, and equipment that are required for the courses at the eligible educational institution. These items must be required of all students in your course of instruction.
-Qualified education expenses do not include the cost of:
-Room and board, Travel, Research, Clerical help, or Equipment and other expenses that are not required for enrollment in or attendance at an eligible educational institution.
How To Apply
Complete all required sections of our application form.
Be sure to attach the following documents to your application form:
-Copy of your most recent transcripts.
-Some verification of enrollment at your college.
Entry Requirements
-Submit a brief essay of between 400 and 800 words, detailing why a career in logistics/supply/ chain management is your college major of choice. A personalized tone, referencing sincere firsthand experience and sentiment, is best—no need to be too formal. We want to know why you truly believe in logistics as the best career path for you!
Award
-Maximum award: $1000.00
-Award amount will be made out to your school in the form of a check, and mailed to your personal address
Notifying the Recipient
- Winner will be notified via email, and on the official Logistics Scholarship homepage after December 15, 2022.
To learn more and start your application, click on the Visit button below. more...

North Park Grant
The North Park Grant is available to students at North Park University. You must demonstrate financial need to qualify for this award. more...

North Spore Mycology Scholarship
We are excited to announce North Spore’s Scholarship 2022 with the purpose of supporting undergraduate students enrolled in an accredited university within the United States and high school seniors who have been accepted into a university program for the Spring of 2023. The scholarship provides a one-time reward of $2,500 to pay for tuition, books, computers, accommodation, and any other educational expenses. We’re in search of students committed to academic excellence and the pursuit of better education, who are currently enrolled in any mycology program, a postgraduate study in mycology, or other related studies.
Eligibility
Must be 18 years old or older
Must be a legal resident of the United States or a holder of a valid student visa
Must be currently enrolled in or accepted to a full-time program in an accredited US university or college
Must be a student of mycology, a postgraduate student in mycology, or another related study
How to Apply
Applicants interested must write a 300-word essay discussing the following:
“In studying Mycology, how can you contribute to creating a greener environment?”
Essays must be sent to scholarships@northspore.com as an attached PDF file, along with your full name, address, contact information, school name, and date of birth.
Use the subject line: North Spore $2,500 Mycology Scholarship | (Your Name)
Only one submission per person is allowed.
You must be able to prove your eligibility based on the above criteria.
By applying, you agree to allow North Spore to use your photo and personal information on their website, social channels, emails, and in marketing materials.
To learn more and start your application, click on the Visit button below. more...

Students are automatically considered for the Provost and Deans Merit Scholarships upon application for admission to Northeastern Illinois University. Completion of an additional application is not necessary. more...

Not Consumed Ministries Scholarship Program
We are thrilled to announce the Not Consumed scholarship for students who strive for excellence and outstanding performance. The Not Consumed scholarship provides a one-time reward of $1,000 to pay for tuition, books, computers, room and board, or any education-related expense. There’s no GPA requirement and no application forms. This scholarship is open to both undergraduate and graduate students attending any accredited college or university within the United States and high school seniors attending classes.
Eligibility
Must be a legal resident of the United States or hold a valid student visa.
Must be currently enrolled in or accepted to a full-time undergraduate or graduate program in an accredited U.S. college or university.
Must be 18 years of age or older.
Applying
For a chance to win the scholarship, write a 500-word essay answering the question:
Who has had the most impact on your educational journey and why?
Essays must be sent to scholarship@not-consumed.com as an attached word document, along with your full name, address, phone number, school name, and date of birth. Use the subject line: Not Consumed $1000 Scholarship | (Your Name).
Only one submission per person is allowed.
Our team will pick the best essay and will notify the winner via email on December 31, 2022. The winner should respond in 7 days; otherwise, another winner will be selected.
To learn more and start your application, click on the Visit button below. more...

Nyc Injury Attorneys P.C. Essay Scholarship
NYC personal injury attorneys are known for getting the best settlement for their personal injury clients. We want to help the future generation of New York City personal injury lawyers fund their education by offering an annual $500 scholarship. The Scholarship will be based on an essay competition focused on personal injury law.
Eligibility
Must be an undergraduate or graduate student enrolled in a U.S. college — program, interested in or seeking a law degree.
Essay must contain your name, address, phone number, current major and college.
Email your essay to nycinjuryscholarship@gmail.com.
Must be a pdf.
Awarding
Deadline is December 31, 2022.
We will announce the winner on our website on January 31, 2022.
To learn more and start your application, click on the Visit button below. more...

Olga Kennedy Scholarship In Kinesiology
HISTORY:
This account was established in December 2012 by Olga E. Kennedy to provide Kinesiology scholarships. Olga E. Kennedy graduate from WIU in 1946 with a degree in women’s PE. She established the scholarship to help female students interested in Kinesiology.
CRITERIA:
 Major in Kinesiology
 Female
 Have completed at least 60 semester hours of credit by the beginning of the award year
 Minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA
 Preference given to a student who demonstrates leadership or outstanding contribution to the field of kinesiology at WIU. more...

Oliver & Mary Troyer Scholarship
Donald and Mary Ann Troyer established the Oliver and Mary E. Troyer Scholarship. CRITERIA: Pursuing Bachelor of Science Degree in Education with the purpose of teaching children ages 3-12, Entering freshman, Minimum 3.0 GPA, Demonstrated potential to be a teacher. more...

Omar Carl Schmeusser Memorial Scholarship
The following criteria must be met:
1. The recipient(s) should be a full-time student with a minimum of 60 semester hours completed, majoring in hospitality management, and accepted to Eastern Illinois University.
2. The recipient(s) shall have an overall GPA of 3.0.
3. The recipient(s) shall have signed an internship agreement to complete a minimum of 240 hours of internship at a Club Managers of America member club. Final determination will be contingent on successful completion of the internship agreement.
4. The recipient(s) should be a member of the Eastern Illinois University student chapter of the Club Managers Association of America.
5. Two letters of recommendation should be submitted for consideration. One letter should be from a hospitality management faculty member and the other letter from a Club Managers of America.
6. The recipient(s) should submit a one-page written letter of intent outlining career goals and the reason for pursuing a career in hospitality management.
7. The recipient(s) should complete an oral interview to be held on EIU’s campus by the Illini Chapter of the Club Managers Association of America who will submit their recommendation to the Scholarship Selection Committee.
8. Financial need may be a consideration but is not a requirement.
9. The recipient(s) may be eligible to apply for and receive the award again provided he/she continues to meet the criteria stated above.
This award will be announced and disbursed in the Fall semester. more...

Organic Life Start Scholarship
Just as others have helped us along our journey, we are passionate to give back in our community. We started the Organic Life Start Empower Scholarship program to have our future generation share stories of those people who have empowered and influenced their lives most. Empowerment can take all shapes and forms, and we love reading your stories.
Each Empower Scholarship has a focused topic, giving applicants the opportunity to share their unique experiences on how they have been empowered, and how they will empower their own future community. We feel strongly about supporting all members of our community who are trying to make themselves better – for a better future that can be shared with all of us.
We encourage you to share your story of empowerment and wish all applicants best of luck with their application!
Scholarship Eligibility
The scholarship is only open to US citizens or permanent legal residents.
Scholarship applicants must either be in their final year of high school, or must be enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate degree program at a US-based higher education institution.
All applications must include a minimum 1 paragraph response to the scholarship prompt question.
All education backgrounds will be considered.
To learn more and start your application, click on the Visit button below. more...

Outstanding First Year Political Science Student Scholarship
The following criteria must be met:
1. The minimum GPA for this award is 3.5 on a 4.0 scale.
2. The recipient must be eligible for financial aid.
3. The recipient must have completed six credit hours in Political Science courses at EIU.
4. The recipient must have completed between 26 and 36 semester hours at EIU.
5. The recipient will be nominated by a Political Science faculty member, and be asked to fill out an application form to be submitted to the department scholarships and awards committee for review.
Nominations and announcements shall be made in the Fall semester and payment of the award shall be issued in the Spring semester. more...

Outstanding New Freshmen Scholarship

Ozier Child And Family Award
The following criteria must be met:
1. The recipient(s) must be a full-time undergraduate student majoring in College of Health and Human Services* or other related field of study with an emphasis on child development in the family services option, or must be a full or part time graduate student in College of Health and Human Services* or other related field of study with a concentration in human and family development, accepted to Eastern Illinois University.
2. The recipient(s) must have an overall GPA of 3.0.
3. The recipient(s) must be of junior standing or above.
4. The recipient(s) must submit a two page typed essay stating her/his family and consumer sciences career goals and demonstrating commitment to the child development profession including area such as advocacy, foster care and education at all levels.
5. The recipient(s) may be eligible to apply for and receive the award again provided he/she continues to meet the criteria stated above.
This award shall be announced and paid during the Fall semester.
*College of Health and Human Services was formerly known as Family & Consumer Sciences
Keywords: human services, aging, hospitality, financial literacy, dietetics, nutrition, child development more...

P.E.O. International Peace Scholarship
The International Peace Scholarship Fund, established in 1949, is a program which provides scholarships for selected women from other countries for graduate study in the United States and Canada. Members of P.E.O. believe that education is fundamental to world peace and understanding. more...

P.E.O. Program For Continuing Education
Need-based grant for women whose education has been interrupted and who find it necessary to return to school to complete a degree or certification that will improve their marketable skills for employment to support themselves and/or their families. more...

Preference will be given to a student with financial need. Applicant must have a minimum 2.5 GPA. more...

Patricia Mason Parson Endowed Scholarship
SCPS – Awarded to students enrolled in SCPS who are in good academic standing and who have financial need. When possible, preference shall be given to students who are single parents.
You MUST be enrolled in at least six credit hours during the quarter in order to meet the eligibility requirements for the scholarship.
This scholarship requires you to upload a copy of your unofficial transcript. If you have not already done so, please go back to the Conditional Application to upload.
**If you are awarded a scholarship, you will receive notification on your Financial Aid Award. You will also be notified via the Scholarship Connect.
For additional information about the scholarship application process, please visit http://www.snl.depaul.edu/StudentResources/Scholarships/index.asp

http://scps.depaul.edu/admission-and-aid/Pages/aid-and-scholarships.aspx more...

Patriot Scholarship
The Veterans Healthcare Scholarship supports veterans transitioning from military service into Healthcare studies and is funded by the College of DuPage Healthcare Initiative Endowment. Applicants must be enrolled in a healthcare or fire science technology major or certificate program, including respiratory care, paramedic, dental hygiene emergency medical services, emergency medical technician, diagnostic medical imaging, nursing, fire science, anesthesia technology, cardiac interventional radiography, mammography, perioperative nursing, phlebotomy, EKG, polysomnography, or similar fields of study at College of DuPage; have finished at least 6 credit hours worth of college-level courses, and meet admission requirements for the Health program. Award: $500 more...

Paul Anast Sigma Chi Fraternity Annual Scholarship
This annual scholarship has been established by Paul Anast to help assist members of the Sigma Chi Fraternity with their educational expenses. Paul is a Sigma Chi Fraternity and WIU alumnus who wants to help alleviate the financial burden of Sigma Chi Fraternity members in good standing who are living in the Sigma Chi Fraternity house during the academic school year.
CRITERIA:
Must be an active member in good academic standing and living in the Sigma Chi Fraternity house during the academic year.
A minimum GPA of 2.5 or better.
Activity/involvement within the Sigma Chi Fraternity and exhibits living the fraternity’s values by serving the local Macomb community.
One-page application highlighting volunteer activities must be submitted to be considered. more...

Paul W. And Katherine T. Hedburn Impact Scholarship
The Paul W. and Katherine T. Hedburn Impact Scholarship provides assistance to students who do not qualify for state and federal aid based on family income but are not receiving family contributions to their education. This scholarship is generously funded by the Paul W. and Katherine T. Hedburn Estate. Applicants must be residents of District 502 (College of DuPage’s district), have a cumulative GPA or better of 2.5 or higher, and be enrolled at College of DuPage full-time (a minimum of 12 credit hours). Award: $2,000; $1,000 disbursed in fall semester and $1,000 disbursed in spring semester more...

Paul W. And Katherine T. Hedburn Map Gap Scholarship
The Paul W. and Katherine T. Hedburn MAP Gap Scholarship provides support for students who are unable to continue their education as a result of the State of Illinois budget crisis. This scholarship is generously funded by the Paul W. and Katherine T. Hedburn Estate. Applicants must be residents of District 502 (College of DuPage’s district); have a cumulative GPA or better of 2.5 or higher; be enrolled in a minimum of 6 credit hours for the applicable semester; be enrolled in a certificate, degree or transfer program at College of DuPage; and complete the FAFSA for the applicable academic year. Applicants must demonstrate that they would otherwise have received State of Illinois MAP Grant funding. Award: $1,250; $625 disbursed for the Fall semester and $625 disbursed for Spring semester more...

Paul W. And Katherine T. Hedburn Student Success And Retention Scholarship
The Paul W. and Katherine T. Hedburn Student Success and Retention Scholarship encourages students to continue their education and is generously funded by the Estate of Paul W. and Katherine T. Hedburn. Applicants must be residents of District 502 (College of DuPage’s district); have a cumulative GPA or better of 2.5 or higher; be enrolled full-time at College of DuPage (minimum of 12 credit hours); be enrolled in a certificate, degree or transfer program at College of DuPage; and file the FAFSA for the applicable academic year. Awardees must continue to meet the initial criteria in order to receive a second disbursement and are required to attend the Foundation’s annual Scholarship Reception. Award: $2,500; $1,500 is disbursed for the fall semester, and $1,000 is disbursed for the spring semester more...

Paul W. And Katherine T. Hedburn Textbook And Supplies Scholarship
The Paul W. and Katherine T. Hedburn Textbook and Supplies Scholarship assists students with the increasing cost of textbooks and educational supplies and is generously funded by the Paul W. and Katherine T. Hedburn Estate. Applicants must be residents of District 502 (College of DuPage’s district); have accumulative GPA or better of 2.5 or higher; be enrolled in a minimum of 6 credit hours for the applicable semesters; be enrolled in a certificate, degree, or transfer program at College of DuPage; and file the FAFSA for the applicable academic year. Applicants must submit a personal statement detailing how they will use their degree to impact their community. Award: $1,000 more...

Paul Yergens & Virginia Yergens Rogers Scholarship
Scholarship for residents of Allen County, Indiana who are undergraduate students attending the University of St. Francis pursuing a degree. Applicants must have financial need and an above average GPA. Due date, number of awards, and award amount may vary. Nonrenewable. Phillip Benne Memorial Scholarship
The Phillip Benne Memorial Scholarship Fund was established in 2012 by Caterpillar Global Security and Securitas Security Services USA, Inc. (through the Phillip Benne Memorial Scholarship Fund Committee) to honor deceased colleague Phil Benne. Benne earned a Bachelor of Science in
Law Enforcement Administration at WIU in 1975. He worked all his life in law enforcement,
starting out as a police patrol officer in the city of Peoria, later becoming a field training officer, serving in the Criminal Investigations Bureau, was a K-9 officer, Special Response Team member and retiring in 2008 as lieutenant of the Technical Services Division after 30 years of service. In 1981 he received the Life Saving Award, 1986 the Distinguished Service Award, 1987 the American Legion Meritorious Service Award, and 1990 the Policemen of the Year award.
After retiring, Benne was hired by Securitas as a facility security manager for the Downtown Caterpillar Campus. He was later promoted to membership in Caterpillar Global Security as a senior security professional, and was then elevated by Securitas to the position of Director of U.S. Operations for the Caterpillar Account. more...

Pipeline For The Advancement Of The Healthcare Workforce (Path)
The Illinois Community College Board has allocated funds through the Pipeline for the Advancement of the Healthcare Workforce Fund (PATH) to the College of DuPage. These funds are to create, support, and expand the opportunities of individuals in the nursing pathway and select healthcare pathways to obtain credentials and degrees that allow them to enter and/or advance their careers in the healthcare industry. Applications are open to assist students with unmet needs on a first-come, first-served basis until funds are exhausted. more...

Pixelplex Bi-Annual Stem Scholarship
The $2000 PixelPlex Bi-Annual STEM Scholarship was established to help support and inspire students to pursue further education in the fields of science, technology, engineering and math (STEM), as well as economics and business. One student will be chosen from the applicant pool and will be awarded based on the strength of their written essay. The selected student will receive 2,000 USD to help cover education-related expenses.
In order to apply for our bi-annual scholarship program, students must meet the following criteria and complete the steps described below:
Eligibility
Be a U.S. citizen or a permanent resident.
Be enrolled (or accepted with plans to attend) in a college or university in the United States.
Applicant’s field of study must be related to science, technology, engineering, math (STEM), economics, or business.
Deadline and Awards Announcement
Deadlines to apply: December 5, 2021.
The winner will be announced at pixelplex.io/scholarship/ within 31 calendar days after the deadline and notified by phone and email.
Application Guidelines
Choose an industry or sector where the application of one of the technologies below might be uncommon, in your opinion, and describe which existing problems will be solved as a result. Pick from these technologies:
Blockchain.
Artificial Intelligence.
Internet of Things.
Augmented Reality/Virtual Reality.
Send an email to scholarship@pixelplex.io with the following:
“PixelPlex Scholarship Award: Applicant’s Name” in the subject field.
A short paragraph or two about yourself.
Attached essay in Word or PDF document.
The essay’s length should be at least 1200 words.
Full name (if under 18, parent or guardian name as well),
College or university name, expected year of graduation, field of study, phone number, email address, proof of attendance or acceptance.
To learn more and start your application, click on the Visit button below. more...

Premier Truck Accident Lawyers Scholarship
At Premier Truck Accident Lawyers, two of the main things we focus on are protection and prevention. We protect people by fighting for their legal rights if they were the victim of a truck accident. We work on prevention by publishing helpful information that builds awareness on how motorists or truck drivers may cause an accident to happen. Your submitted truck accident article may land you a $500 scholarship if your article is chosen!
Eligibility
You may enter this scholarship if you have been accepted or are already attending any trade school, graduate / undergraduate program, college, or university in the United States.
Applying
Send your original article on autonomous trucking to sean@thepecklawgroup.org, including the following information:
Full name, address, and phone number.
Which college or trade school you are going to be attending / currently attending.
If you are under 18 years of age, please provide us with your legal guardians contact details.
Please include your name and email address within the filename of your article. For example, the file name may look like this: ‘Rose Bronson rbronson@gmail.com Effects of Driverless Trucks.docx’
To learn more and start your application, click on the Visit button below. more...

Psychology.Org Scholarship Catalogue
Psychology.org was founded in 1997 by William Palya, Ph.D., and Donald Walter, Ph.D., and has been operated by RV EDU, a digital portfolio of education websites, since 2019. Our content creators are trained on research and editorial best practices to ensure all information comes from reputable sources like government databases, industry publications, and first-hand interviews. We also turn to professionals in the field of psychology who contribute to or review our content for accuracy and completeness. Note that articles that have gone through this review process are labeled with a reviewer byline.
To view this organization’s available scholarships, click the Visit button below more...

Public Relations And Advertising Merit Scholarship
The MA in PRAD program is happy to offer merit scholarship funding for the Spring 2020 quarter to continuing graduate students who have shown high levels of academic achievement, engagement with the program and professional development. All students with a GPA of 3.5 or higher are invited to apply.
To apply, please submit:
• A LinkedIn bio. Make this a short and personalized summary of your passions and expertise (approximately 50- 100 words long)
• A short personal statement (150-250 words) on the one or two most important lessons (or skills) you’ve learned through the program and what you hope to continue learning
• A current resume (including your involvement in the MA program and/or professional associations)
*This scholarship cannot be combined with the Graduate Tuition Award in the same term. Students receive the best scholarship in any given term. Full time staff using the tuition waiver are not eligible for this award. more...

Public Relations And Advertising Merit Scholarship Application
The MA in PRAD program is pleased to offer merit scholarship funding to continuing graduate students in the PRAD graduate program who have shown high levels of academic achievement, engagement with the program and professional development.
To apply, please submit:
• A LinkedIn bio. Make this a short and personalized summary of your passions and expertise (approximately 50- 100 words long)
• A current resume (including your involvement in the MA program and/or professional associations)
• A copy of your unofficial transcript
Fine print: This scholarship cannot be combined with the Graduate Tuition Award or the Double Demon Scholarship in the same term. Students receive the best scholarship in any given term. This merit scholarship is usually worth more than the Graduate Tuition Award or the Double Demon Scholarship. Full time staff using the tuition waiver are not eligible for this award. Combined degree students who are still seniors are not eligible for this award. This award can be retroactively applied to Spring tuition bills. If you paid your Spring tuition in full, you would likely be issued a refund.
Deadline: Monday, April 11, 2022 more...

R.M. Myers Award

Rachel Stapp Teaching Scholarship
The following criteria must be met:
1. The recipient(s) must be a full-time, majoring in Elementary or Secondary Education, accepted to Eastern Illinois University.
2. Financial need is a consideration.
3. Applicants must be sophomores, juniors, or seniors.
4. The selection committee shall give first preference to a graduate of Brownstown (IL) High School. If there are no applicants from Brownstown (IL) High School, the secondary preference is a teacher candidate from any high school in Fayette County, Illinois. If there is not a viable candidate from either of these preferences, then the best overall applicant will be selected.
5. The recipient is in good academic standing.
Award announced in the fall and awarded in the spring. more...

Retention Of Illinois Students & Equity (Rise) Act
The Retention of Illinois Students & Equity (RISE) Act allows eligible undocumented students and transgender students who are disqualified from federal financial aid to apply for all forms of state financial aid. The Alternative Application for Illinois Financial Aid provides a pathway for these qualified students to apply for Monetary Award Program (MAP) grants, the state’s largest need-based grant program for low-income college students.
The following links provide important information on the application process:
RISE Act Alternative Application FAQ’s
Pathway to Apply for ISAC Programs
Application for MAP: Alternative Application for Illinois Financial Aid
Alternative Application for Illinois Financial Aid Process
Applying for Other ISAC Programs
The following link takes you directly to the application:
RISE Act Application
For additional questions please contact:
DePaul Central more...

Richard Decordova Memorial Endowed Fund
The American Studies Program at DePaul University sponsors the Richard deCordova Scholarship competition to honor and celebrate our late, beloved colleague, a founding member of the American Studies Program, and one of the Program’s most loyal supporters. In keeping with Richard deCordova’s teaching and scholarly interests, and with his own standards of excellence, essays or projects in U.S. American Studies or U. S. film or media studies, by currently enrolled DePaul undergraduates, are eligible for the scholarship.
Essay or project submissions will be evaluated based on:
• originality
• interdisciplinary perspective
• clarity in reasoning, writing, and presentation
• adequate and correct documentation
In addition, essays or projects previously submitted as a part of a class requirement, as well as revisions of such essays or projects, are eligible for submission—as are essays or projects designed only for the competition. Each student may submit only one entry. If a collaborative project is submitted and wins, the scholarship will be split. Only one submission will receive a monetary award, which will be dispersed to the student’s account during the winter and spring quarter. During some awards cycles, the deCordova Awards Committee may also select an honorable mention; Honorable Mentions will receive a certificate but will not receive a monetary award.
Essays must be a minimum of 1500 words (not counting notes/citations). Projects may include, but are not limited to creative works such as plays, films, or exhibits. All non-essay-based projects MUST include a 500 word statement explaining the project’s intended intellectual/artistic contribution, and how the project has been influenced by interdisciplinary perspectives.
Students are responsible for adhering to the submission requirements of their specific project. If you have any questions, please contact the American Studies Program.
Submission instructions:
• If you are submitting an essay, please upload it in the file upload prompt provided within the application. Remove your name from any essay submissions. Do not include your name as part of your essay’s file name.
• If you are submitting another work, including but not limited to a play, film, exhibit, or another interdisciplinary project, please submit all necessary materials to document the project so that the committee can evaluate it. Please also include your 500 word statement (see above). Remove your name, to the extent that is possible, from all materials.
• If you need to submit something that cannot be uploaded or linked, please fill out the application online, give a short description of the project via the short answer box, indicate that you are submitting a separate copy. Email AMSdept@depaul.edu for the details. Your project must be submitted before the due date of the application.
In keeping with the spirit of Richard deCordova’s intellectual interests, American Studies majors/minors and Media, Cinema, and Studies majors/minors are especially encouraged to apply, but all DePaul students are welcome to submit their materials for consideration.
In order to be considered for this scholarship, please be sure to upload your unofficial transcript as recommended in your general application. more...

Richard J. & Joan M. Meister Endowed Scholarship For Community-Based Service Learning
The Richard J. Meister Scholarship lies in the tradition of DePaul scholars who critically reflect on societal issues and problem solving methods to achieve societal goals and engage in service within the local and/or global community.
The Irwin W. Steans Center for Community-based Service Learning at DePaul University invites current DePaul students to apply for the Richard J. Meister Scholarship. The Meister Scholarship is an award of $1,500 for DePaul University students for the 2021-2022 academic year. Applicants should have prior experience doing community-based work, assisting individuals served by community-based organizations, advocating for causes, or other experience that demonstrates commitment to civic engagement. All DePaul students are eligible, with a special consideration for students ages 25 and older. more...

Riversville Foundation Scholarship Application
DEADLINE TO APPLY HAS BEEN EXTENDED. NEW DEADLINE is July, 10 2022 by 11:59pm
The Riversville Foundation Scholarship was created to support highly promising minority students in meeting their academic and personal goals and will be awarded for the 2022-2023 Academic year.
Consideration for this scholarship shall be given to full-time students at DePaul who have at least Sophomore standing, have financial need, who have a minimum GPA of 2.75, who have been involved at DePaul and their greater community, and have leadership and service experience serving marginalized communities.
APPLICANTS MUST MEET ALL OF THE FOLLOWING CRITERIA
Be an underrepresented minority student and a Sophomore or Junior in Fall 2022
Be Pell Grant eligible with significant unmet financial need
Student began their college studies at DePaul University as a Freshman
Demonstrate a commitment to service and student involvement
Demonstrate leadership skills
Be active in the community
Possess a cumulative GPA of 2.75 or above

Demonstrate financial need by having a Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) on file with the Office of Financial Aid (DePaul)
Be a full-time undergraduate student at DePaul University
ADDITIONAL INFORMATION
By completing the application for this scholarship you are authorizing the Office of Multicultural Student Success and the Scholarship Committee to review your financial and academic records in order to assess your application.
Please direct ALL QUESTIONS regarding this scholarship to:
Darryl Arrington • Assistant Vice President
Office of Multicultural Student Success
EMAIL: darringt@depaul.edu more...

Roberson Business Scholarship
The following criteria must be met:
1. The recipient(s) must be full-time students, accepted to Eastern Illinois University.
2. The recipient(s) must qualify for admission to the School of Business and major in Business.
3. The recipient(s) must display a need for financial aid.
4. The recipient(s) must display the potential for leadership and academic promise.
5. The recipient(s) must have good moral values.
6. The recipient(s) must be persistent in the Christian religion of his/her choice.
7. The recipient(s) must be a resident of the State of Illinois.
8. Special consideration should be given to student-athlete applicants.
This award will be announced in the Fall and awarded in the Fall and Spring semester. more...

Robert A. Ingram Scholarships For Entrepreneurship Students
Criteria for selection are as follows:
a. The recipient(s) must be a full time junior or senior with a declared minor in Entrepreneurship accepted to Eastern Illinois University
b. The recipient(s) must be in good academic standing
c. The recipient(s) must have a minimum overall 3.0 GPA
d. The recipient(s) must have completed the following course with a grade of A or B: ENT 3300 Foundations of Entrepreneurship
e. The recipient(s) must currently be enrolled in one of the following courses: ENT 3500 Marketing and Innovation for Entrepreneurial Ventures or ENT 3700 Financing for Entrepreneurial Ventures or ENT 4500 Entrepreneurial Management and Venture Plan Development
f. The recipient(s) must submit a current resume, transcript, and a statement of interest (maximum of 600 words) that addresses the following:
i. Career interests or goals and how the entrepreneurship minor will help to achieve them.
ii. Work, family, and/or personal experiences and how they have helped to form entrepreneurial related career goals
Financial need is a consideration. The recipients are not eligible to apply again for this or other entrepreneurship scholarships at EIU.
This award is announced and awarded in the Fall. more...

Robert A. Pringle Memorial Scholarship
The following criteria must be met:
1. The recipient(s) must be admitted to the Bachelor of General Studies Program (BGS) and accepted to Eastern Illinois University/Northeastern Illinois University.
2. The recipient(s) must be in good academic standing and exhibit the potential to do college work. Life experience, interests, and completed academic work shall be considered.
3. Financial need is a consideration.
4. The recipient(s) must have at least one semester of coursework to be completed following the semester in which he/she was selected.
5. The recipient(s) may be eligible to receive the award again provided he/she meets the criteria.; however, preference is given to first-time recipients.
This award is announced and awarded twice each year.
Keywords: interdisciplinary studies, IDS, general studies, BGS, liberal arts, multidisciplinary, online, non-traditional, nontraditional, adult, adult learning, adult learner, degree completion, adult education, evening degree more...

Robert And Howard Weitzman Endowed Scholarship

Robert And Sandra Collier Early Childhood Education Scholarship
Bob and Sandy Collier were dedicated educators throughout their careers. Both Bob and Sandy were born and raised in California and met while teaching elementary school in Riverside, California. Bob received his MA and PhD in education, focusing his dissertation on young children’s play.Bob, Sandy and their two young sons moved to Macomb in 1979 where Bob began his career at Western Illinois University as a professor in Early Childhood Education in what is now the Department of Curriculum and Instruction. He later served as Interim and Assistant Chair of the Department. He was a beloved mentor to many of his students and colleagues and was honored as the Outstanding Teacher in the College of Education in 1990-91. He retired in 2000.
Sandy received her MS in Early Childhood Education from WIU and thoroughly enjoyed teaching first grade for the Colchester/West Prairie School District for 19 years. She worked with many student teachers during that time and received the Troyer Outstanding Mentor Teacher Award in 2004.
In retirement, both Bob and Sandy have actively volunteered in organizations supporting the growth and development of young children. Upon Bob’s death in 2017, the Colliers’ family and friends established this scholarship to honor Bob and Sandy and to provide assistance to students who share their deep commitment to early childhood education. more...

Robert Lang Blakslee Memorial Scholarship
This scholarship is in memory of Robert Lang Blakslee, who was born the first son, and fourth of five children, to Kathryn and Edward Blakslee in 1954. Robert Lang Blakslee’s life was taken prematurely at the age of 16; however, the effect that he had on the entire Blakslee family will never be forgotten. CRITERIA: The student must be declared a special education major (intending to qualify for certification as a Learning Behavior Specialist I) and accepted into the Teacher Education Program (TEP). Preference is given to a student whose emphasis or concentration is in the area of mental retardation. more...

Robert N. And Barbara V. Sullivan Scholarship
The following criteria must be met:
1. The recipient shall be an undergraduate full-time student, accepted to Eastern Illinois University, majoring in Career and Technical Education major with a Business Education emphasis.
2. The recipient shall show financial need.
3. The recipient shall always be eligible to receive the scholarship again, as long as she/he remains in compliance with the above requirements and maintains a satisfactory academic record.
This award is announced in the Fall and disbursed in the Fall and Spring semesters. more...

Robert S. Krause Scholarship
Robert Krause received his bachelor’s degree in art in 1967. He was Vice President for Institutional Advancement at Kansas State University beginning in 1986. Mr. Krause coordinated the University’s daily activities with the Alumni Association, Foundation and Athletics Department. Prior to working at Kansas State, he was the director of student affairs at Minnesota State University.

Child or grandchild of a WIU alumnus

Rocio Automotive Technology Scholarship
The Rocio Automotive Technology Scholarship supports an African American student studying in the Automotive Technology program and is generously funded by College of DuPage Foundation Board member Yolanda Rocio. Applicants must be currently enrolled in or admitted to College of DuPage, be of African American descent, be enrolled in the Automotive Technology program, have and maintain a cumulative GPA or better of 2.5 or higher, and file the FAFSA for the applicable academic year. Applicants must be enrolled in a minimum of 6 credit hours for the applicable semester. Applicants must submit a personal statement of up to 250 words describing their background, hobbies, interest in the field of automotive technology, and career goals. Award: $1,000 more...

This scholarship is generously funded by College of DuPage Foundation Board member Yolanda Rocio. Applicants must be currently enrolled in or admitted to College of DuPage, be of African American descent, be enrolled in the Computer & Internetworking Technology (CIT) program, have and maintain a GPA or better of 2.5 or higher, and file the FAFSA for the applicable academic year. Applicants must be enrolled in a minimum of 6 credit hours for the applicable semester. Applicants must submit a personal statement of 250 words or less describing their background, hobbies, interest in the field of computer internetworking technology (CIT), and career goals. Ruth E. Brandenberg Memorial Scholarship
The following criteria must be met:
1. The scholarship is to be available to students studying College of Health and Human Services*.
2. The scholarship recipient(s) must be enrolled full-time at Eastern Illinois University.
3. The recipient(s) shall be completing his/her freshman year and entering into his/her sophomore year.
4. The recipient(s) shall be chosen based on academic excellence (i.e. in good academic standing/not on probation, minimum GPA 3.0) and good moral character (i.e. the applicant shall submit two letters offering character references and /or two letters which demonstrate civic service or community involvement).
This award shall be announced in the Fall semester and split between the Fall and Spring semester.
*College of Health and Human Services was formerly known as Family and Consumer Sciences which was formerly known as Home Economics
Keywords: human services, aging, hospitality, financial literacy, dietetics, nutrition more...

Samuel I. Bailin Memorial Endowed Scholarship
Due to a generous gift from the family, friends and colleagues of Samuel I. Bailin, scholarship money is available to students enrolled as majors or minors within the School of Hospitality Leadership. The Samuel I. Bailin Memorial Endowed Scholarship can augment any additional funding a student may have previously been awarded.
Awarded to undergraduate students enrolled in the School of Hospitality Leadership who demonstrate financial need and are in good academic standing. Additional consideration may be given to students considering a career in food service management and/or supply-chain operations or a similar field.
All students enrolled as majors and minors in the School of Hospitality Leadership are eligible, and encouraged, to apply for additional scholarship funding. In addition to financial need (as determined by the FAFSA), included in the review process is also consideration for cumulative GPA (2.0 or higher), student activity such as belonging to hospitality clubs or holding club leadership positions, and having full or part time jobs in the hospitality industry.
To be considered for the scholarship:
Complete the online application
Upload a current resume.
Upload the following essay: Describe your interest in Food Service Management and/or supply-chain operations and how this scholarship will help you in pursuing that interest (single spaced; one proofread page maximum).
Students may apply for any, or all, School of Hospitality Leadership scholarships; however, separate applications are needed for each award. In order to be considered for the Samuel I. Bailin Memorial Endowed Scholarship, you must complete all required fields of the online application and upload all supporting documentation as requested per the scholarship requirements.
*SCHOLARSHIP APPLICATION DEADLINE: Sunday, September 19th, 2021 *
Please note, in order to be considered for the Samuel I. Bailin Memorial Endowed Scholarship, you must complete all required fields of the online application. Applications must be completed and submitted online by 11:59:59 PM on Sunday, September 19th, 2021. Incomplete or late applications will not be considered. more...

Samuel N. Oliva Scholars Program - Four-Year Scholarship Totaling $24,000
This program was established by Samuel Oliva, WIU Accountancy graduate and Certified Public Accountant since 1977. It is a four-year progressive scholarship:
Year 1 = $2,000/year
Year 2 = $4,000/year
Year 3 = $8,000/year
Year 4 = $10,000/year
Total Scholarship Value = $24,000
Any student receiving this scholarship, who has completed 60 SH and who remains eligible for renewal of the scholarship will automatically qualify for an accounting internship at ECS Financial Services. Internships include housing, if needed.
CRITERIA:
Incoming freshman
Accounting major (including pre-major)
Full-time enrollment
Minimum 3.2 high school GPA

Minimum 25 ACT or 1200 SAT

Exhibits leadership, community service, and extracurricular activities
This scholarship is renewable up to three years if the student maintains full-time enrollment in the Accounting program with a 3.2 WIU GPA and 3.2 major GPA. The student must also complete ACCT 201 and ACCT 202 by the end of their sophomore year (Year 2) in order to maintain eligibility. more...

Samuel N. Oliva Scholarship
Established in 2001, this was the first WIU scholarship established by Samuel Oliva, WIU Accountancy graduate and Certified Public Accountant since 1977. Shortly after his graduation and before he was 30 years old, Mr. Oliva began providing annual scholarships to Accountancy students. In 2001, he established the initial endowment that funds these scholarships. This endowment was the first endowment supporting the Accountancy program to grow to $100,000 and then $500,000. With his recent $500,000 challenge/match pledge, Mr. Oliva set the course for this endowment to grow to over $1.1 million by 2019. Income earned by this endowment will provide scholarships in perpetuity for Accountancy students. Currently, three Samuel N. Oliva scholarships valued at $4,000 each are awarded each year. Samuel N. Oliva scholarships support continuing students in Accountancy here at WIU. Please see the selection criteria below. Newly admitted freshmen Accountancy students are strongly encouraged to apply for the new Oliva Scholars Scholarship. Information for the new Oliva Scholars Scholarship is located on the WIU Scholarship Portal under the Accountancy program.
CRITERIA:
Undergraduate or graduate
Accounting major
Minimum 6 credit hours enrollment at time of application (part-time students must demonstrate continuous enrollment and progress towards graduation)
Minimum 60 credit hours earned by the end of the spring semester of deadline
Minimum 3.2 WIU GPA and minimum 3.2 major GPA

Demonstrated leadership through involvement in student organizations in the Department of Accountancy (BAP, Accounting Society, Society of Accountancy)
Any student receiving this scholarship will automatically qualify for an accounting internship at ECS Financial Services. Internships include housing, if needed. more...

1. The recipient must be a full-time undergraduate or graduate student, majoring in College of Health and Human Services*, accepted to Eastern Illinois University.
2. The recipient must maintain an overall GPA of at least 2.8.
3. The recipient may be eligible to apply for the award again, but can only receive two awards.
This award will be announced in the Fall and paid in the Fall or Spring semester.
*College of Health and Human Services was formerly known as Family & Consumer Sciences

School Of Accountancy Scholarships
Scholarship for incoming freshmen accepted to DePaul Universitys School of Accountancy. The following criteria are guidelines, not minimums. Student should have a minimum composite ACT of 27 or combined SAT of 1220, rank in the top 10% of their high school class, and present an outstanding record of involvement in campus and/or community activities. Finalist must attend an interview in February. The Ledger & Quill scholarships are for full-tuition, the Charles Melvoin & Eldred Strobel scholarships are for 1/2 tuition, and the Goss scholarships are for $2,000. Number of awards varies. All are renewable; up to 3 additional years. more...

School Of Continuing And Professional Studies - Undergraduate
SCPS – Awarded to an undergraduate student enrolled in the School of Continuing and Professional Studies who is in good academic standing and demonstrates financial need.
You MUST be enrolled in at least six credit hours during the quarter in order to meet the eligibility requirements for the scholarship.
This scholarship requires you to upload a copy of your unofficial transcript. If you have not already done so, please go back to the General Application to upload.
**If you are awarded a scholarship, you will receive notification on your Financial Aid Award. You will also be notified via the DePaul Online Scholarship Application.
For additional information about the scholarship application process, please visit http://snl.depaul.edu/admission-and-aid/Pages/aid-and-scholarships.aspx

School Of Hospitality Leadership Endowed Scholarship
*Awards for this scholarship will apply to the 2021-2022 Academic Year.
The School of Hospitality Leadership Endowed Scholarship is open to all students enrolled as majors, minors, in the School of Hospitality Leadership. Graduate students in our MS or in the MBA taking at least one concentration in Hospitality are eligible so long as the student is NOT eligible for the DePaul Double Demon Discount (meaning that the student completed a previous degree at DePaul) or is in the Hospitality MBA Cohort.
In addition to financial need (as determined by the FAFSA), included in the review process is also: consideration for cumulative GPA (2.5 or higher), student activity such as belonging to hospitality clubs or holding club leadership positions, or having full or part time jobs in the hospitality industry.
Students may apply for any scholarship offered through the School; however, separate applications are needed for each award. Students may apply repetitively during each and every cycle unless stated otherwise. In order to be considered for a School of Hospitality Leadership Scholarship you must complete the entire application as requested per the scholarship requirements.
To be considered for this scholarship you must:
Demonstrate financial need (as determined by the FAFSA);
Complete the application before the deadline;
Submit a current resume;
Upload an essay explaining how this scholarship will impact your education and your future goals in the industry. Be as
specific,
concise, and thoughtful as possible. Limit the essay to 1 single spaced, proofread page.
Applications must be completely SUBMITTED by 11:59:59PM on SUNDAY, SEPTEMBER 19TH, 2020. Incomplete or Late applications will not be considered.
Please Note: By completing this application online, you are authorizing the School of Hospitality Leadership Scholarship Committee to obtain your financial aid records from the Financial Aid Office. Further, by electronically signing your application, you will hereby certify that the information provided in the application is accurate. more...

Scottsdale Wealth Advisory Free Scholarship Fund
Learn about our free scholarship. At Scottsdale Wealth Advisory we recognize the value of giving back to our community. For this reason, we created the Scottsdale Wealth Advisory Fund. Each year we select one student to receive this award for the most creative and well-written essay on a different subject. The winner of the award may use the money for school admission, books, cost of living, lab fees, travel fees and graduation.
Free Scholarship Award Eligibility
-Enrollment verification at an accredited university, community college, online college or high school
-Current high school seniors
-Current college students
-US citizen or permanent resident
-Minimum 2.0 GPA
-Scholarship winner must submit a self-photo with Scottsdale Wealth Advisory award
-Winner will also grant permission to Scottsdale Wealth Advisory to use the self-photo for future promotional use of the Scottsdale Wealth Advisory Fund
Essay Details
In 750 words or less, describe why financial planning is important to young adults?
Deadline
Student applicants must submit their essay no later than 12/01/2022. more...

Applicants must be a student enrolled in the College of DuPage Nursing program, be beginning their second year in the Fall term, have a cumulative GPA or better of 3.0 or higher, and file the FAFSA for the applicable academic year. Shane Van Vleet Memorial Scholarship For Biological Sciences
This scholarship has been funded by Carrie Van Vleet in memory of her husband, Shane Van Vleet. Shane, a native of Macomb, graduated from WIU in 2002 with a Bachelor of Science degree in Biology. He then attended Southern Illinois University Edwardsville School of Dental Medicine, graduating in 2007 with Honors. Shane was very proud of the education that he received at WIU and how it prepared him for a career in the medical field.
CRITERIA:
Applicants must either be a junior or senior at WIU majoring in Biological Sciences, with preference given to a pre-dentistry student.
A minimum GPA of 3.5 or better.
Resident of McDonough or Hancock County
Planning to attend medical school or entering a healthcare or medical profession
Financial need using the FAFSA or other information
Activity/involvement within the Department of Biological Sciences and/or the community.
Scholarship may be renewed for a second year as long as the student maintains a 3.5 GPA or better and continues to major in Biological Sciences. more...

Sheila A. Grone Roehlk Scholarship (Transfer)
Sheila attended Farnham, Allen Park, and Lombard schools before she graduated from Galesburg High school in 1959. She received an Illinois State Scholarship to attend Western Illinois University, graduating with a B.S. in Education in 1963. She received her Master’s in Education from the University of Illinois in 1966. She was awarded the National Defense Education Act grant to continue post graduate work at Northwestern Illinois University. She also studied at the University of Iowa, Illinois State University, and Northern Illinois University. Sheila taught at Allen Park, L.T. Stone, Steele, Nielson, Cooke, and Galesburg High Schools. She was a principal at Allen Park and Costa Catholic Academy as well as a part-time assistant to the Knox County Superintendent of Schools.
She was a past member of Alpha Delta Kappa and Phi Delta Kappa. Sheila was a life member of Sigma Kappa social sorority, the Illinois Education Association, and the National Education Association.
CRITERIA:
Minimum 3.25 GPA (high school GPA if entering freshman and transfer GPA if new transfer)
Financial need
Must award to qualified applicant if a graduate of Galesburg High School, IL
Education major
If no Galesburg High School graduate, second priority given to graduates from a Knox County, IL high school
If there are no applicants who meet these criteria, the scholarships shall then be made available to all education majors more...

CRITERIA: Major in the Department of Law Enforcement and Justice Administration (LEJA), Minimum cumulative 3.0 GPA, Good judicial standing, Demonstrate strong potential for a career in law or law enforcement and justice administration. more...

Sieben Edmunds Miller Criminal Defense Scholarship
The attorneys of Sieben Edmunds Miller are pleased to offer a biannual, national, needs-based scholarship for undergraduate students and law students. We remember our own law school experience fondly; the education and networking opportunities we received during undergrad and law school continue to be invaluable to this day. We hope our scholarship will reduce the financial burden on students pursuing a career in criminal justice and allow them to focus on making the most of their education.
Eligibility
This is a national, needs-based scholarship for students pursuing a career as a criminal defense attorney. Undergraduates and law school students are encouraged to apply.
Award
-Our scholarship is biannual. One winner will be chosen and awarded $1000.00 each spring and fall semester.
How To Apply
To apply, please complete our online application. You must submit all application materials by the current deadline in order to be considered for the scholarship
Scholarship Deadline
- The current scholarship deadline is December 30th, 2022 for Spring Semester 2023.
To learn more and start your application, click on the Visit button below. more...

Silva Injury Law Scholarship
At Silva Injury Law, we believe that our duty goes beyond achieving large monetary awards for our clients. We strive first to be decent human beings who seek not to stir up fights, but to solve problems. We want to encourage all law school students to fight for those who need justice.
Award Eligibility
Must be currently enrolled or accepted in an accredited law school in the U.S.
Submission of application and essay
Essay Topic: how did you decide to become a lawyer, and how do you plan to use your skills to bring justice to the community?
Essay Length: between 300-500 words.
Submit your essay by February 28, 2023. One winner will be selected by email on March 15, 2023.
To learn more and start your application, click on the Visit button below. more...

Silyx Scholarship
